And to top it off, they are available in both wired and wireless versions. 

SoundMolds are innovative, custom-made earbuds that merge comfort, clarity, and longevity to create a product you’ll wish you met years ago.Whether you choose the wired or wireless option, you’ll get a complete set of flexible, hypoallergenic, silicone earbuds that are specially tailored for your ears. So instead of the old “square peg in a round hole” route most earbuds go, with SoundMolds it’s more like placing a puzzle piece to its perfect fit.Using a pair of earbuds that actually fit your ear has the added luxury of blocking unnecessary background noise.   Much like your eye doctor has to take measurements to create a custom prescription for glasses, we need to do something similar for your ear.When you order your SoundMolds, we'll ship you your EarPrint Impression Kit straight to your door, you'll take 8 minutes to create an impression using the kit, and mail it back! It’s that easy!And in about 2 weeks after we receive your EarPrint impressions, you’ll have your snug-as-a-bug earbuds. And trust me - they’re worth the minimal wait. Once you spoil your ears with these snuggly ear wonders, you won’t be able to live without them!And yes - shipping is prepaid so you don't need to worry about that!   It isn’t hard to understand why run-of-the-mill earbuds fall out. They’re usually slippery, very generically shaped, and have no real grip. So if you start to work up a sweat or move too much, it’s enough to cause them to bail from your ears. With SoundMolds, a custom fit means that they’re staying put no matter how sweaty you are or how extreme your movements. These earbuds will stay put. * Always ensure that you are safe when wearing earbuds. The SoundMolds noise-reduction feature is adjustable so that you can still hear what's around you!

 
 
 

 
 In line with the generic shape and rigid plastic, most earbuds are painfully inflexible and definitely don’t take your individual ear shape into account. This crummy design means there’s bound to be aching pressure points and discomfort. Poor fit means that when you take them out, it’s like changing from your tight, starched pants after Thanksgiving dinner into super-soft oversized sweats. Removing your earbuds shouldn’t bring such relief, and no ears deserve that tight-pants fit.The customized shape of your SoundMolds earbuds will be so welcome and cuddly to your ears that they might cry a little when you remove them, so don’t be alarmed. (Ears have feelings, too.)  The fact of the matter is, no matter HOW great your acoustics are, if you don’t have a perfect seal between the ear and the outside environment, your sound experience will suffer.  Background noise can not only distort your listening experience, it can actually end up seriously damaging your ear health. When we feel the need to up the volume to drown out the background noise, we’re often unaware of the dangerous decibel levels we’re inflicting on our poor ears.But if you have a fit so precise that it creates a secure seal that gently hugs every curve of your ear while thoroughly eliminating background noise, you can happily listen to your audio at lower levels without needing to punish your ears with high volume. SoundMolds are more than a custom solution Just imagine how much better you’ll be able to focus and concentrate without the distraction of your earbuds diving from your ears or incessant background noise...That annoying meathead shout-grunting with every lift at the gym? Silence him with quiet workout tunes.The screaming toddler on the airplane? You can’t hear a thing as you listen to your podcast.Your snoring partner who’s giving the plane a run for its money? Quiet as a lamb while you drift off to ambient sleep sounds…And all thanks to the perfect seal created by your cushy, hypoallergenic earbuds. Available in Wired and Wireless Versions  HEM Wired Earbud:
Latest Hi-Resolution Knowles™ Balanced Armature Driver for an immersive performance.
Acoustically calculated and vibration free Lexan™ earpiece for comfortable and fatigue free fit.
Linear-Phase crossover for seamless driver integration . Two replaceable cables included: microphone cable when listening music on-the-go and high-end cable made of OFC and silver for the best performance.
BE Sport Wireless earbud:
13 grams lightweight metal body design.
Supports aptX and AAC codecs.
10-hour continuos playback.
DuPont Kevlar ballistic material wire coating.
Ingress Protection Rating of level 5 dust and level 5 water jet protection.
Magnetic back side of earphones to help secure in place around the neck when not in use
  See his first impression wearing SoundMolds Testimonials"Amy, the earbuds are AMAZING. You and your office team were wonderful. I'm so grateful to be able to have the ear bud. They fit comfortably and I don't hear much. " -Elaine Rosenthal​"Wearing headphones is a pretty big part of my life. In the gym, traveling, or working, I spend a significant amount of time with headphones in. SoundMolds sound great, don't fall out, and fit perfectly in my ears. I believe you should invest in things you enjoy and spend a lot of time with. For me, SoundMolds is my investment in the music I enjoy every day."  - [real estate dev.]“If you have standards or care about yourself, sound molds are the only way to wear headphones. Whether it be that they stay in my ear no matter what (especially if I'm working out), or providing a comfortable isolation of outside sounds, SoundMolds are like no other. If I'm in the library studying late at night, they block out any distraction.”  -  [college student]          “I am a50 year old very active man who has always had an issue with my earbuds falling out.  I must have small ears, because the standard buds that come with my headphones never seemed to fit me correctly.  Whenever I would be running, mountain biking or just working out at the gym, when I started to sweat at all they would fall out.  A friend told me about Soundmolds so I gave it a try.  I couldn’t be happier.  No matter what activity I am engaged in, they just stay in place and feel totally comfortable.  I’m never going back to off the shelf buds.“  - Scott K., Cincinnati, OH "I have tiny ears so I stopped wearing earbuds because they never fit me well. Most earbuds would either hurt my ears or fall out. My SoundMolds have changed that for me and let me listen to my music again!"  - Melanie V. “I started using Sound Molds three months ago and I haven’t put them down since. I found the product online while searching for an earbud that fit properly. I have a pair of Plantronics, three pairs of beats and two pairs of Bose earbuds and none of them stay in my ear. Nor do they feel comfortable. Every time I purchase a pair of earbuds my ears hurt for at least the first week- they are all sold with small, medium, and large fittings but none of them properly sit in my ear.Then I found Sound Molds. A kit was shipped to me with very easy instructions on how to create the molds. It took me less than 10 min from unpackaging to repackaging and shipping them back to the company. Within a few weeks I received my Sound Molds and I literally haven’t taken them out of my head since! The fit is flawless. The sound is profound! If you’re looking for a headset that you will last you for years, one than you can actually hear and one that will stay in ear, buy this product.“ - Ryan R.  Thinking SoundMolds might be a good fit for you? Let’s see what would make you a good match:* Your current or previous earbuds have repeatedly fallen out* You dig comfort and quality* You don’t want to slowly go deaf* You think snuggling your ears in cushy, customized silicone sounds great* You want earbuds that will last* You appreciate a great sound experience* You’re not averse to making your friends jealous We’re committed to not only providing an innovative product we feel will change your life, but we’re also committed to working hard to ensure you have a great experience from start to finish.A lot of work went into this campaign, and we’ve made sure our ducks are in a row in order to fulfill our backers’ orders as soon as the campaign closes.You can feel confident backing SoundMolds because we’ve got a great relationship with a well-known manufacturer whose quality we stand behind.  Plus, the materials we’re using are so good that we’re happy to offer a full, 1-year  warranty against defects. FoundersJerry Altman (left) is board certified Ear, Nose and Throat Doctor. As an avid exerciser, he loves to listen to music, podcasts, and audiobooks. He's been deaf in his left ear since childhood, so he is vigilant about protecting the hearing in his right ear from excess noise exposure.Amy Shah (right) is a double board certified MD in allergy/immunology and internal medicine. She is a big proponent of nutrition, and wellness integrated into western medicine -- she loves the intersection of wellness and productivity -- which is why she loves SoundMolds.Product Launch Team Like everyone else, we’re no strangers to the sound and fit issues most earbuds present, and that’s exactly why we created SoundMolds.And because we’re doctors, we want earbuds that not only prevent hearing loss by reducing the need for damaging volume levels, but offer a comfortable, hypoallergenic fit that’s actually good for your health.While researching solutions, we discovered that professional musicians and elite consumers had access to custom-fit earbuds, but only after visiting an audiologist and then paying a ridiculous sum to get the earbuds of their dreams several weeks later.We loved the concept, but not the wait, need to visit an audiologist, or insanely high price!And that’s what led to this campaign.We feel EVERYONE (not just celebrities or the ridiculously rich) should have access to great earbuds that are comfortable, stay put, and last year after year. 
 Your SoundMolds will be ready to ship as soon as our Indiegogo campaign closes. Once the campaign closes, we'll send our backers a survey to collect your color preference. As soon as we receive yours, we'll ship you your Custom Earprint Impression Kit. When you mail your custom impression back to us (we cover the cost of return shipping), you'll receive your finished, custom SoundMolds within two weeks. How soon will I get my kit?As soon as the campaign closes, we'll send all of our backers a survey to get your color preference. As soon as we receive your color preference, we'll ship our Custom Earprint Impression Kit to your door!What if I can’t get a good impression?To try and make this as easy as possible, we’re sending you written instructions, video instructions, and two sets of the moulding material (so you can totally mess up one and still try again). But if you’re still having issues, we’ll have support staff on hand to answer your questions via telephone. We’re here for you!How long will it be before I get my finished, customized earbuds?There’s only a two-week period from the time we receive your impressions to the time we send out your custom earbuds. (We’ve mastered this quick turnaround thing!)What will this cost?We’re offering a wired set of SoundMolds for just $189, and a wireless set for $199 - a significantly discounted price from what they will retail for.What if I get them and they don’t fit right?If you’re not completely happy with the fit, we’ll be happy to troubleshoot. And if we need to send you another impression kit and create another pair, we’ll do it.Are they waterproof?SoundMolds are not waterproof, but they are sweat resistant.How do I clean them?You can clean your SoundMolds between uses with a clean, damp cloth to keep them in tip-top shape.Since they give such a great seal, can I use them as earplugs?We do not recommend using your SoundMolds for earplugs at this time. However, we *do* have plans to produce SoundMold earplugs in the near future, so if you’d like to be one of the first to know when they’re available, you can visit our website here and sign up for the mailing list right at the top of the page!Can I return them?As you will undoubtedly understand, because this is a fully custom product, we’re unable to offer refunds. But we fully guarantee the manufacturing quality of the earbuds and will do all we can to make sure you’re as thrilled as we expect you to be!What does the guarantee cover?We paired with a well-known manufacturer, and because we know they’re made of quality materials, we’re able to offer a full, 1-year warranty against manufacturing defects.A few things not covered under the manufacturer's warranty are cord damage, failure or improper function due to wax in the earpiece, abusive damage to the earpiece, and earpiece modifications by non-SoundMolds personnel.For more information, please contact us at support@soundmolds.com

story:
What is a Soundwalk?

Short Summary

The Soundwalk is an interactive, geo-locative audio tour. Anyone is free to join, and as you walk around the city, you hear sounds as you pass through the streets. What sounds? Anything goes, from tourist information to music, but for our first content we wanted to do something special, and invited two sound artists to give us their "sonic vision" of the city, through music and field recordings.

At its core, the Soundwalk is a smartphone app and a map of sounds. To explore a Soundwalk, you need headphones, and the phone must be equipped with GPS and optionally other location technologies. When you open a Soundwalk map, sounds will be played as if you are hearing them from a point, like surround sound, except the arena is the real world! That means, when you move around the sounds will appear to be coming from a particular location, and you can discover other sounds as you walk around.

We are a very small team of three passionately dedicated people based in Hanoi, creating interesting sonic projects, and we have already managed to raise core support for some areas of the project, but it’s not enough yet.

Last year, the project was unfunded, but we still made it happen. This year we’re doing it in two cities at opposite ends of the world, Copenhagen and Hanoi, and offering two sound artists from those cities a unique opportunity to create a work of art for a new medium. In those two cities, the walk will be completely free for participants. We need your support to make it happen.

What we need

To make our project happen, we need a minimum of $5000. This money goes towards:

  • Paying talented Vietnamese composer Lương Huệ Trinh for her work on the project. We believe it’s essential to pay artists fairly for their work.
  • Flights to Denmark and accommodation. We need a presence in Denmark to organise the Soundwalk there, and make sure things run smoothly. Let us know if you want to help out by volunteering for the walk there!
  • Administrative support for the project. A significant amount of our time is going into this project; our costs are really low, but we still need money to cover our expenses.
  • App development. We already have a small amount of money to pay for some development time, but this app will require hundreds of hours of work. We need to cover that time at a fair rate for our developer.
  • The remainder will go towards giving you your perks!

We have already obtained core funding for the project from the Danish Embassy in Vietnam’s Cultural Development and Exchange Fund which pays for:

  • Flights for our talented artists to Copenhagen and Denmark
  • Their accommodation and costs in both cities
  • Some money towards software development
We have also got support from the Danske Jazz Beat og Folkemusik Autorer (DJBFA) which pays for the fee of our talented Danish composer Hans Sydow


Stretch budget

$8,000 – We're really excited and hoping to reach this first stretch goal where we will add a Soundwalk Market for people to browse, access and upload Soundwalks for any location in the world. That would open a whole new dimension to the project.

This will allow people arriving in a city to select a tour to their fancy. Imagine being able to select a Historical Landmarks tour spoken by an experienced tour guide, or a Traditional Music tour that gave a unique insight into the music of a place, or even a Relaxing Soundscape tour that provided a different way of looking at your surroundings.

$10,000+ – For each $5000 we get above the budget, we will add a city to our itinerary. That means we’ll come and visit your city, create a special Soundwalk and run the walk there with our devices. If you contribute more than $500 you can vote towards what that city will be.

What you get

Imagine, as the number of available Soundwalks develop, instead of "what do I want to listen to today?", you'll be wondering "where do I want to listen to today?".

That's where our perks come in. Depending on how much you contribute, you could land yourself with access to our app before the Soundwalk project runs. Then you can try it out for yourself!

Want to be an integral part of the project? Sponsor a sound – you can have your name next to a sound on one of our first Soundwalks!

What about something to listen to the Soundwalk on, but you don't have a suitable smartphone? We've got brand new Nokia XLs on offer!

And a pair of kick-ass GPS location-enabled headphones to listen to it on too? We've got those too.

What about if you want the ultimate – a Soundwalk in your city now? Well, if we make our stretch goals and you contribute enough, we'll add a city, and you can vote for it! Not only that, we'll invite you along for a pre-run of the Soundwalk so you can experience it before anyone else.

The Impact

The Soundwalk project is unique. In Hanoi last year, this was the first time a project of its kind had happened in South-East Asia. We want to trump that this year with a global collaboration and more open accessibility. Everyone should be able to take part, at no cost to them.

  • You’ll be helping to make the Soundwalk 2014 happen. People like you will be able to go on the Soundwalk at no cost, and experience a magical audio tour in your own city.

  • Last year, the Hanoi Soundwalk ran for the first time in collaboration with the larger Locative Audio project which brought together soundwalks all over the world.

  • Our goal is make the Soundwalk a global project, which anyone in any city in the world can experience. We want to visit more cities, create more Soundwalks, and allow anyone to upload a Soundwalk they’ve created.

  • One great success of the 2013 Soundwalk was our work with visually-impaired children in Hanoi; by improving and polishing the software and content we hope to make it an experience widely accessible to the visually impaired community.

The App

So we hear you say “What if I don’t live in Hanoi or Copenhagen? When is the Soundwalk coming to me?”. It will come to you in two ways.

First, the Soundwalk creation app we’ll develop for this project finally gives content creators and audience access to the full creative potential of the “soundwalk” concept. We are experienced researchers and developers in the field of computer sound and music, we have experimented in real life, with an audience, several existing software options, have measured their limitations, and are now dedicated to producing, in close collaboration with our two sound artists, a software that will truly transform the physical space into a canvas for sound creators to “paint” on and turn a place into an actual consistent work of sonic art.

  • New app features will include, alongside the basic functions:
  • non circular areas, so the sound can track along a street
  • beat-synchronization of groups of sounds for musical Soundwalks
  • conditional sequencing of sounds, enabling ‘story-telling’
  • precise control of spatialization options for individual sounds, with true 3D audio
  • non-location specific sounds, to enable ‘introductions’ or in-app notifications
  • partially randomized sounds or sound parameters
  • and much more -- we will work closely with both of our sound artists to develop new features based on their needs.

This way we’re giving you and others all the tools you need to create and share truly seamless and immersive Soundwalks in the places you care about.

And if you don’t quite feel like turning into a creator just yet, no worries: we also want to add to the player app a ReMap feature that will allow you to transpose any created Map from its original area onto your city or town, so you can experience any city without the hassle of taking a flight there, and enjoy the improbable encounter of sounds designed for that place with your daily environment.

Press

Last year we were covered by a number of publications in Hanoi:

TV:

VTC10 Program - Nghe dạo Hà Nội: Hành trình khám phá lịch sử sống Hà Nội qua âm thanh. [Hanoi Soundwalk: An exploratory journey of Hanoi's history through sound]

“You can hear sounds like vehicles, the beating of woodblocks, which touch the soul; or the sounds of contemporary Hanoi like the train passing … from there you can imagine what Hanoi was like in the past"

VTC2 Program - Nghe dạo Hà Nội: Cơ hội độc đáo khám phá lịch sử thủ đô [Hanoi Soundwalk: A unique opportunity to experience the history of the capital]

"Nowadays Hanoi is modernising a lot; however there are familiar things like the 36 old streets from olden days, which nobody has a chance to discover, especially through sound…"

Print/Online:

The Word - Surround Sound on the Hanoi Soundwalk

 “…it isn’t just something to be listened to at home. It is meant to be heard, and experienced…”

Thể Thao Văn Hoá - Nghe dạo Hà Nội: Ôn sử bằng... âm thanh [Hanoi Soundwalk: Learn history through… sound]

"The feelings of the participants were stirred by some melancholic sentences: the sighs of beggars, the heart-rending lamentations of the famine of 1945 or the steps of the army resounding on the earth, the cheers of victory echoing from the skies."

Đảng Cộng Sản - Khám phá lịch sử Hà Nội qua âm thanh phố phường [Hanoi Soundwalk: A unique opportunity to experience the history of the capital]

'...This is an interesting new global trend! It combines many things and creates a diversified documentation…'

Tiền Phong - Nghe dạo Hà Nội: Qua âm thanh 'cảm' lịch sử [Hanoi Soundwalk: ‘Feel’ history through sound]

"I'm so happy to hear the peaceful sounds of old Hanoi through the the trains passing, the sound of the monochord, the cries of children, the sounds of glasses clinking together. When I hear the electric tram, I imagine them but I don't know if I looks as I imagined" Dương Bùi Khánh Linh, visually impaired student of Nguyễn Đình Chiểu school.

Đại Biểu Nhân Dân - Nghe dạo Hà Nội [Hanoi Soundwalk]

"This is not a chance just for Hanoians but also for expats who live in Hanoi to discover the city's history"

Hà Nội Mới - Nghe dạo Hà Nội: Câu chuyện lạ về âm thanh [Hanoi Soundwalk - A strange story in sound]

"From sounds of everyday life and archival sounds, the recordings aim to provoke things hidden from our busy contemporary lives"


The people involved

The Artists

Lương Huệ Trinh - Vietnamese composer and sound artist

Trinh is the most promising of the new generation of Vietnamese artists working in sound. This year she’s been invited to Shanghai and Istanbul to perform and give lectures, and she’ll be working on installations and even a feature film. She’s worked on many projects with the broad-reaching experimental music organisation Đom Đóm in Hanoi, and regularly plays with experimental musicians who visit Hanoi.

Hans Sydow - Danish composer and sound artistHans is working on a number of major sound installations internationally. He often works in the field between poetry, sound and music, using language and concrete sound as a musical material. He received the three-year grant of the Danish Arts Foundation in 2007 for his work with music communication, and since 1996 he has worked with making history come alive through sonic retelling. He has created sonic design for museums around Denmark, and produced sound and music for installation, concert and theater in Denmark, Sweden, Germany and USA.

The Soundwalk Team

Josh Kopeček - Artistic Director and Project Facilitator. Managed the Soundwalk in 2013, and will facilitate the project again this year. Josh holds a PhD in Music from the University of Manchester, and his background is in experimental music and sound art as well as technology.

Mathias Rossignol - Creative Director and Software Programmer, worked on the 2013 Hanoi Soundwalk. Mathias holds a PhD in Computer Science and has worked in research centers in France and Vietnam, including the presitigious IRCAM (Paris). This year, he will work on rewriting the Soundwalk platform software.

Đinh Lê Vân - Project Facilitator, worked on the 2013 Hanoi Soundwalk as translator, administrative assistant, press attachée. Vân holds a Bachelor degree in Finance but has been working in international relations field in various aspects, including as an international coordinator at Vietnam National University now. She will facilitate the Soundwalk in Hanoi this year.

Risks & Challenges

This project needs your support. There are a number of challenges we’re going to face, and below we details them, and how we’re addressing them:

  • In Copenhagen we will need to find a place to designate and support for the walks. This could be a local institution or business that lends us some space to work. We’re already in contact with a number of people that could provide this, and our contingency is to run the Soundwalk without local support, which is feasible, if undesirable.

  • We need to create a new app that directly integrates support for geolocation. We’ve already started working on this and have a dedicated programmer on the task. There is the risk that the app will not be complete in time for the first walks, so we’re working to a strict timeline to get it finished.

  • We’ve got to set up a server that hosts the Soundwalks and integrate it with the app. There is the risk that the server costs and setup time will be more than we can manage. Last year we simply hosted the project files on cloud storage, which will be our fallback solution for this year.

  • Traffic safety and general safety on the walks is a concern, especially in Hanoi where one has to walk on the road. Last year we recruited volunteers to help guide people on the walks, and we’ll be doing the same this year, in both Copenhagen and Hanoi.

  • As with any project based upon new technology, a risk of technical failure is unavoidable. We will test the software thoroughly throughout development, both ourselves and with focus groups.


Other Ways You Can Help

What you can do to help us if you can’t contribute:

  • Please share our campaign on facebook and twitter, click the links above!

  • Please tell people about it, if you like the idea!

  • Are you in Copenhagen or Hanoi? We’ll need volunteers to help when we’re running the Soundwalks, so please get in contact.

Timeline

July - Crowdfunding campaign
August - Preparation and development of the Soundwalk app
August - September - Shipment of the first batch of rewards
September - Soundwalk launches in Copenhagen!
October - Soundwalk in Hanoi

FAQ

Will the Soundwalk app be available on iOS?

No. Currently we're only developing for the Android platform. We would very much like to develop an iOS version, so you can be assured it will be in the pipeline!

Credits

Massive thanks to:

Locative Audio, who supported the project in 2013 and brought together a massive 13 cities to the project. Looking forward to working with them again in 2015!

The Danish Embassy in Hanoi's Cultural Development Fund for their generous support for the project. We wouldn't be where we are now without them.

Danske Jazz Beat og Folkemusik Autorer (DJBFA) for providing a generous grant so that Hans Sydow can take part in the project.

Intelligent Headset for providing the incredible locative headphones that, once you try them, you won't want to go back to ordinary headphones.

Questions and suggestions

We value your insights and opinions! Email us at hello@soundwalkproject.com

Last year, the Hanoi Soundwalk ran for the first time in collaboration with the larger Locative Audio project which brought together soundwalks all over the world.
Our goal is make the Soundwalk a global project, which anyone in any city in the world can experience. We want to visit more cities, create more Soundwalks, and allow anyone to upload a Soundwalk they’ve created.

One great success of the 2013 Soundwalk was our work with visually-impaired children in Hanoi; by improving and polishing the software and content we hope to make it an experience widely accessible to the visually impaired community.
The AppSo we hear you say “What if I don’t live in Hanoi or Copenhagen? When is the Soundwalk coming to me?”. It will come to you in two ways.First, the Soundwalk creation app we’ll develop for this project finally gives content creators and audience access to the full creative potential of the “soundwalk” concept. We are experienced researchers and developers in the field of computer sound and music, we have experimented in real life, with an audience, several existing software options, have measured their limitations, and are now dedicated to producing, in close collaboration with our two sound artists, a software that will truly transform the physical space into a canvas for sound creators to “paint” on and turn a place into an actual consistent work of sonic art.

New app features will include, alongside the basic functions:


non circular areas, so the sound can track along a street


beat-synchronization of groups of sounds for musical Soundwalks


conditional sequencing of sounds, enabling ‘story-telling’


precise control of spatialization options for individual sounds, with true 3D audio


non-location specific sounds, to enable ‘introductions’ or in-app notifications


partially randomized sounds or sound parameters


and much more -- we will work closely with both of our sound artists to develop new features based on their needs.

This way we’re giving you and others all the tools you need to create and share truly seamless and immersive Soundwalks in the places you care about.And if you don’t quite feel like turning into a creator just yet, no worries: we also want to add to the player app a ReMap feature that will allow you to transpose any created Map from its original area onto your city or town, so you can experience any city without the hassle of taking a flight there, and enjoy the improbable encounter of sounds designed for that place with your daily environment.PressLast year we were covered by a number of publications in Hanoi:TV:VTC10 Program - Nghe dạo Hà Nội: Hành trình khám phá lịch sử sống Hà Nội qua âm thanh. [Hanoi Soundwalk: An exploratory journey of Hanoi's history through sound]“You can hear sounds like vehicles, the beating of woodblocks, which touch the soul; or the sounds of contemporary Hanoi like the train passing … from there you can imagine what Hanoi was like in the past"VTC2 Program - Nghe dạo Hà Nội: Cơ hội độc đáo khám phá lịch sử thủ đô [Hanoi Soundwalk: A unique opportunity to experience the history of the capital]"Nowadays Hanoi is modernising a lot; however there are familiar things like the 36 old streets from olden days, which nobody has a chance to discover, especially through sound…" Print/Online:The Word - Surround Sound on the Hanoi Soundwalk   “…it isn’t just something to be listened to at home. It is meant to be heard, and experienced…”Thể Thao Văn Hoá - Nghe dạo Hà Nội: Ôn sử bằng... âm thanh [Hanoi Soundwalk: Learn history through… sound]"The feelings of the participants were stirred by some melancholic sentences: the sighs of beggars, the heart-rending lamentations of the famine of 1945 or the steps of the army resounding on the earth, the cheers of victory echoing from the skies."Đảng Cộng Sản - Khám phá lịch sử Hà Nội qua âm thanh phố phường [Hanoi Soundwalk: A unique opportunity to experience the history of the capital]'...This is an interesting new global trend! It combines many things and creates a diversified documentation…'Tiền Phong - Nghe dạo Hà Nội: Qua âm thanh 'cảm' lịch sử [Hanoi Soundwalk: ‘Feel’ history through sound]"I'm so happy to hear the peaceful sounds of old Hanoi through the the trains passing, the sound of the monochord, the cries of children, the sounds of glasses clinking together. When I hear the electric tram, I imagine them but I don't know if I looks as I imagined" Dương Bùi Khánh Linh, visually impaired student of Nguyễn Đình Chiểu school.Đại Biểu Nhân Dân - Nghe dạo Hà Nội [Hanoi Soundwalk]"This is not a chance just for Hanoians but also for expats who live in Hanoi to discover the city's history"Hà Nội Mới - Nghe dạo Hà Nội: Câu chuyện lạ về âm thanh [Hanoi Soundwalk - A strange story in sound]"From sounds of everyday life and archival sounds, the recordings aim to provoke things hidden from our busy contemporary lives"The people involvedThe ArtistsLương Huệ Trinh - Vietnamese composer and sound artistTrinh is the most promising of the new generation of Vietnamese artists working in sound. This year she’s been invited to Shanghai and Istanbul to perform and give lectures, and she’ll be working on installations and even a feature film. She’s worked on many projects with the broad-reaching experimental music organisation Đom Đóm in Hanoi, and regularly plays with experimental musicians who visit Hanoi.Hans Sydow - Danish composer and sound artistHans is working on a number of major sound installations internationally. He often works in the field between poetry, sound and music, using language and concrete sound as a musical material. He received the three-year grant of the Danish Arts Foundation in 2007 for his work with music communication, and since 1996 he has worked with making history come alive through sonic retelling. He has created sonic design for museums around Denmark, and produced sound and music for installation, concert and theater in Denmark, Sweden, Germany and USA.The Soundwalk TeamJosh Kopeček - Artistic Director and Project Facilitator. Managed the Soundwalk in 2013, and will facilitate the project again this year. Josh holds a PhD in Music from the University of Manchester, and his background is in experimental music and sound art as well as technology.Mathias Rossignol - Creative Director and Software Programmer, worked on the 2013 Hanoi Soundwalk. Mathias holds a PhD in Computer Science and has worked in research centers in France and Vietnam, including the presitigious IRCAM (Paris). This year, he will work on rewriting the Soundwalk platform software.Đinh Lê Vân - Project Facilitator, worked on the 2013 Hanoi Soundwalk as translator, administrative assistant, press attachée. Vân holds a Bachelor degree in Finance but has been working in international relations field in various aspects, including as an international coordinator at Vietnam National University now. She will facilitate the Soundwalk in Hanoi this year.Risks & ChallengesThis project needs your support. There are a number of challenges we’re going to face, and below we details them, and how we’re addressing them:
In Copenhagen we will need to find a place to designate and support for the walks. This could be a local institution or business that lends us some space to work. We’re already in contact with a number of people that could provide this, and our contingency is to run the Soundwalk without local support, which is feasible, if undesirable.
We need to create a new app that directly integrates support for geolocation. We’ve already started working on this and have a dedicated programmer on the task. There is the risk that the app will not be complete in time for the first walks, so we’re working to a strict timeline to get it finished.
We’ve got to set up a server that hosts the Soundwalks and integrate it with the app. There is the risk that the server costs and setup time will be more than we can manage. Last year we simply hosted the project files on cloud storage, which will be our fallback solution for this year.
Traffic safety and general safety on the walks is a concern, especially in Hanoi where one has to walk on the road. Last year we recruited volunteers to help guide people on the walks, and we’ll be doing the same this year, in both Copenhagen and Hanoi.
As with any project based upon new technology, a risk of technical failure is unavoidable. We will test the software thoroughly throughout development, both ourselves and with focus groups.
Other Ways You Can HelpWhat you can do to help us if you can’t contribute:
Please share our campaign on facebook and twitter, click the links above!
Please tell people about it, if you like the idea!
Are you in Copenhagen or Hanoi? We’ll need volunteers to help when we’re running the Soundwalks, so please get in contact.
TimelineJuly - Crowdfunding campaign
August - Preparation and development of the Soundwalk app
August - September - Shipment of the first batch of rewards
September - Soundwalk launches in Copenhagen!
October - Soundwalk in Hanoi
FAQWill the Soundwalk app be available on iOS?No. Currently we're only developing for the Android platform. We would very much like to develop an iOS version, so you can be assured it will be in the pipeline!CreditsMassive thanks to:Locative Audio, who supported the project in 2013 and brought together a massive 13 cities to the project. Looking forward to working with them again in 2015!The Danish Embassy in Hanoi's Cultural Development Fund for their generous support for the project. We wouldn't be where we are now without them.Danske Jazz Beat og Folkemusik Autorer (DJBFA) for providing a generous grant so that Hans Sydow can take part in the project.Intelligent Headset for providing the incredible locative headphones that, once you try them, you won't want to go back to ordinary headphones.Questions and suggestionsWe value your insights and opinions! Email us at hello@soundwalkproject.com

story:
World's First Wireless Headset to Stream Music, Podcasts, & Live Coaching Underwater


Water sports have been under-served by technology for too long. Say goodbye to clunky MP3 players and pesky cords. Zygo is an IP68 waterproof headset and transmitter compatible with any smart device. We spent two years developing our patent-pending solution that will change the way you experience the water. 

 

Stream High-Quality Audio Underwater

We believe that the inability to stream audio in the water is a critical barrier to widespread enjoyment of swimming and other water sports. We developed Zygo to enable high-quality streaming audio with any phone (or audio source). Play Spotify, a podcast, audio book, or Peloton-style guided workouts using the Zygo App.

 

Non-Invasive Bone Conduction Technology

The Zygo headset uses bone conduction to send audio through vibrations against the zygomatic arch, leaving your ears open for comfort and safety. 

 

Completely Wireless 

Out of the box, Zygo comes with: a headset, transmitter, and charging case. The headset and transmitter connect wirelessly, so you can stream all of your audio cord-free. The carrying case doubles as a charging station. Using the micro USB cable that comes with it, plug the case into any outlet to charge both units simultaneously.  

 

Bluetooth can't penetrate the water, so we use a radio frequency transmitter as middleman. The transmitter stays on land with your phone and streams its audio to the headset. It doubles as a walkie-talkie for real time one-way communication.

Zygo is the only technology that lets you stream live, online audio underwater from your favorite apps. 

 

Range 

The exact range depends on how deep you are and the type of water (salt water versus fresh water makes a big difference). At 2 feet below the surface in a chlorinated swimming pool, the range should be 50 meters. Since our head is normally at the surface when we swim, the range should be greater in most cases. Above the water - for activities like standup paddle boarding and windsurfing - the range is up to half a mile.

 

Live One-Way Communication

The handheld transmitter doubles as a walkie talkie with a built-in push-to-talk mic that allows anyone to reach you, be it for real time coaching or a safety alert.

 

Zygo App

The Zygo App contains pre-recorded workouts to simulate live coaching sessions. You’ll gain instant access to a growing library of content designed for swimming, paddle boarding, and more! Enhance your favorite activities with structured training material and upbeat music. 

App Features

  • Quick Start. Select a workout by time or distance.
  • Content. Enjoy new workouts from our ever-growing library.
  • Favorites. Build your own program by favoriting workouts.
  • Variety. Train with diverse personalities across sports.
  • Community. Join others in a shared fitness experience.
  • Music. Enhance your exercise with energy and motivation.
  • Customize. Choose a higher or lower intensity workout for your level/preference.

The Zygo App is free to download and free to use through 2019.

 

What Makes Zygo Better Than Other Earbuds & Headsets?

Not Just Swimming

While the initial idea came from swimming, we quickly realized that Zygo could enhance other water sports such as windsurfing, kitesurfing, surfing, stand up paddle boarding, and more.

Unlike other products that clip to goggles, Zygo is a versatile solution for all of these outdoor activities. It can be worn with sunglasses and under a hat, and we plan to offer accessories such as a wetsuit clip.

 

Backed By Olympians, Athletes, & World-Class Coaches

 

Perks

Zygo is only available on Indiegogo with our biggest discount at up to 40% Off.  Plus, we're offering Free Shipping to all of our Indiegogo backers!

Pledge now to take advantage of exclusive Early Bird pricing and be the first to experience wireless audio streaming underwater!

 

Product Details

 

Our Story


 

Like all kids, we loved swimming when we were little. Jumping into the water gave us a fun, carefree way to cool off on hot summer days in our hometown of LA.

As we got older, swimming disappeared from our lives until we realized, as 30-year olds, that we hadn’t enjoyed swimming for decades. We watched boutique fitness studios turn other sports into engaging, community-driven activities, while swimming appeared solitary, intimidating, and monotonous. Where was the innovation?

We loved group fitness classes, and wanted a similar experience in the pool where we could improve our strokes and stamina with real-time instruction, encouragement, and music. It would be low-impact and full-body - the perfect addition to our fitness routines. We couldn't find such a class, so we designed one ourselves.

Our first company, SwimTeam, gave participants an entertaining and convenient way to build confidence in the pool by making it social and stress-free in a 45-minute swimming-based group exercise class. But recreating the studio environment in the pool was no easy feat. It’s the high-energy playlist and charismatic instruction of SoulCycle and Barry's Bootcamp that make those classes so popular. We needed an elegant way to transmit live instruction and music to our swimmers. After months of attempting to hack existing technologies to fit our needs, we realized that the ideal solution did not exist. We never planned on becoming a hardware company, but we quickly realized that everyone else wanted this product too.

So two years ago, we set off to create Zygo, and now we’re on the cusp of sharing it with the world. Hardware is hard, as the saying goes. And expensive. We’ve raised angel money thus far in order to make our vision a reality, and every penny has gone into product development.

We’re ready to pull the trigger on mass production, and need your support to make that happen. Your campaign contribution will go towards manufacturing the product. It’s as simple as that. Thank you for being part of our story.

We love hearing from you. If you have any questions, you can reach us at hello@zygoco.com. 

 

 

 

 

Our logo took inspiration from the two types of waves that Zygo interacts with: audio waves and water waves.

 

World-Class Partners

We assembled a team of top design and engineering talent to overcome the many challenges involved in a product of this complexity. 
 

LA-based product development studio Boombang created the Zygo industrial design. They based the shape of the transmitter after the “g” in our logo, and included other clever details like having the headset's two bone conduction holders resemble water drops.

 

The Five Nine is not your traditional digital agency. Based in LA, they specialize in crafting and executing big ideas for clients both large (Nike) and small (Zygo) in a nimble and down-to-earth approach. They helped us with creative direction, content creation, photography, videography, and post production. 


Design consultancy Outerspace leveraged their experience with waterproof products to devise Zygo's complex mechanical engineering solution, and guide us through the tooling process and first production run. With offices in Melbourne and San Diego, they were able to work seamlessly with our US and China partners.

Just last month, we were at our factory in China assembling the first units! Take a look.

 

Risks & Challenges

We’ve de-risked as much of the technology as possible through months of prototyping, but with a product of this complexity there are many variables during the ramp-up phase and start of mass production. Indeed, the reason that no streaming solution already exists is because of how hard it is to make! Waterproofing, radio frequency, bone conduction, compact design, universal sizing - each of these things alone is a huge challenge, and Zygo contains all of them. And more! 

Fortunately, we’ve recruited a strong team to help us navigate this next phase, including a quality control specialist from GoPro. In addition to their on-the-ground support, the two of us will continue to frequently visit the factory in person. (Charlie speaks Mandarin, which comes in handy!) We won't ship the product until we're confident that it will meet your expectations, but we're optimistic that our current timeline is realistic.

 

Timeline

story:
Jooki is a fun music player that anyone can use anywhere, anytime. Designed to share the magic of music with the entire family, including the youngest ones.

  • A portable music player with built-in high-quality speakers
  • Uses figurines, not a screen to choose what music is played
  • Designed to be kid-proof: strong, safe and with smart parental controls
  • Plays files stored on Jooki (sourced from CD's, iTunes, ...)
  • Supports streaming from internet radio's and streaming services (Spotify, ...)
  • Works as a Bluetooth speaker for your phone

www.jooki.rocks

 

As kids, the music and stories on tapes & CDs enriched our lives. As geek dads, we love the advances in technology but we see them leaving our family behind when it comes to music.

With Jooki we designed an easy and magical music player that allows kids to choose their own music or stories without a distracting screen. The kids dance freely to music and stories fire their imagination.

With Jooki kids choose what they want to listen to, and when they do so. But parents set the boundaries. So they can share their love of music and spoken word without worries. No screen in sight.

Jooki plays anything: it doesn't matter whether it's an offline MP3 or an online streaming service. We're committed to bring all major streaming services to Jooki so that you can offer an unlimited catalog to your kids. But again, the parents stay in control.

We are starting with Spotify support so that your kids will be able to play their favorite playlist, be it “Kids Workout”, “Disney” or “Once upon a time”. 

 

 

Jooki is a music player with a simple, intuitive user interface for all ages. Jooki is a standalone jukebox that plays from on-board storage and also a wireless speaker that streams from the phone or the cloud.

The Jooki Stars make Jooki shine. The Stars are figurines and tokens that start a playlist (song, story, album or internet radio station). Perfect for kids: they simply place a Star on Jooki to choose what they want to listen to.

The parents app isn’t required to play music but lets you stay in control and upload the music you want to share with the family.

Easy & Fun - Simply place a Star on Jooki to play the music you want.

 

 

 

 

Listening to music or stories has never been so easy and fun! Kids love the independence Jooki gives them. They get to choose the music and stories to listen to without having to ask an adult for help. And with no screen in sight, kids listen and play without distractions.

 

 

 

The Jooki Stars are beautiful figurines and practical tokens that can be linked to your children’s favorite playlists.

The figurines are fun, colourful characters and easy for small hands to grasp. The tokens are flat with fun designs (or use your own stickers). Both types of Star work exactly the same way and have suction cups so they don’t fall off Jooki.

 

 

Managing music on Jooki is easy

  1. Choose the music you want to listen to. You can upload music from your phone using the Jooki app or drag-and-drop from iTunes on your laptop. You can also choose a Spotify playlist or an internet radio station.
  2. Create a playlist (or have Jooki create one for you).
  3. Choose the Star you want to link to the playlist and put it on Jooki. Done.

A playlist is one or more songs, stories, albums, or online radio stations.

 

 

Kids love to be in control of the world and Jooki gives them this independent access to their music and stories. At the same time the parents app lets you set boundaries. You choose when the kids can use Jooki and the media available on the device. You can set the maximum volume and you can always use the app as a remote control. The app is free and easy to use!

 

 


Jooki is designed for demanding children, but as parents ourselves, we demand quality, safety and ease of use. Jooki works on-the-go, bedroom or living room, inside or outside and of course it sounds great!

 

In the box - 1x Jooki, 1x Figurine Star, 5x Token Stars, 1x charging cable

 

 

You will be able to choose your figurine type(s) after the campaign; we'll send you an email.

 

 

Founding Team - Theo, Will & Pieter

Theo Marescaux

Theo was the Product Manager for 40% of the world’s digital cinema projectors that show movies to millions of people around the world. His new mission is to delight children with a 21st century music experience.

Will Moffat

Will has been programming and designing hardware since the age of 7, when he built his own computer alarm system to catch Santa Claus. He also worked at Google on Search, presumably still searching for Santa.

Pieter Palmers

Pieter likes to disassemble gadgets, spin records, play music and has always been fascinated by audio technology. He led a team at Huawei working on next generation wireless chips for 5G smart phones and base stations.

Founding Team carrying Early Test Audience

 

Extended Team

Thanks go out to

  • Guillermo & Ruth - Jooki Spain
  • Yves - Thanks for the amazing job on the video!
  • Martin, Martina, Filip - Thanks for helping us have great pictures!
  • Jimi - Thanks for the cool visuals!
  • Koen Vingerhoets - Crowdfunding ninja skills
  • Paul, Jan, Henry - Marketing advice
  • Samit, Annissa - Thanks for helping us with online marketing!
  • Riso, Andy, Will, Lewie, Cynthia - Thanks for prototyping support!
  • Danny, Jean-Marc, Marush, Lenka
  • Special Js - Jo, Joke, Johana

Memberships

Prototyping Jooki

The early days

Prototyping modern Jooki

 

Jooki comes packed with modern technology (which fades into the background where it belongs). 

  • Wifi 802.11b/g/n 
  • Bluetooth 4 Smart Ready
  • MicroSD Card Connector for Offline storage
  • Music Formats Supported : MP3, AAC, OGG, FLAC, WAV, AIFF 
  • Streaming Services: possible but subject to licensing deals
  • App: Android, iOS, HTML5 (for Windows Phone, PC & Mac) 
  • Charging: MicroUSB (charging cable included)
  • 3.5mm headphones jack
  • Battery : 1800mAh (8hrs play time) 
  • Dimensions: 175 x 175 x 70mm
  • Weight: <700g (TBD)
  • Splash-proof (but not fully waterproof)

 

We’ve added an estimated $10 shipping cost to every order. Because our backers can be all over the world we ship directly from Hong Kong. You will be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

We are working on local distribution channels to reduce shipping cost. Any progress on this will be put in our regular updates.

Estimated delivery is September 2017.

Risks and challenges

Bringing a physical product to life is challenging, even more so when it’s a children's product. To address this challenge we’ve been working with top manufacturers of both toys and audio products on product design, sourcing and scheduling. We have explicitly chosen not to take risks on production techniques, materials or components to avoid manufacturing and sourcing issues.

Notwithstanding the margin in our timeline and the confidence we have in ourselves and our partners, we see the following points where delay could accrue: 

  • Safety concerns 
  • Quality concerns 
  • Hiccups in the regulatory approval 
  • Financial risks

We are determined to make Jooki a quality product and also ship as promised. We will keep our backers well informed, should we encounter hurdles.
story_txt:
Jooki is a fun music player that anyone can use anywhere, anytime. Designed to share the magic of music with the entire family, including the youngest ones.
A portable music player with built-in high-quality speakers
Uses figurines, not a screen to choose what music is played
Designed to be kid-proof: strong, safe and with smart parental controls
Plays files stored on Jooki (sourced from CD's, iTunes, ...)
Supports streaming from internet radio's and streaming services (Spotify, ...)
Works as a Bluetooth speaker for your phone
www.jooki.rocks As kids, the music and stories on tapes & CDs enriched our lives. As geek dads, we love the advances in technology but we see them leaving our family behind when it comes to music.With Jooki we designed an easy and magical music player that allows kids to choose their own music or stories without a distracting screen. The kids dance freely to music and stories fire their imagination.With Jooki kids choose what they want to listen to, and when they do so. But parents set the boundaries. So they can share their love of music and spoken word without worries. No screen in sight.Jooki plays anything: it doesn't matter whether it's an offline MP3 or an online streaming service. We're committed to bring all major streaming services to Jooki so that you can offer an unlimited catalog to your kids. But again, the parents stay in control.We are starting with Spotify support so that your kids will be able to play their favorite playlist, be it “Kids Workout”, “Disney” or “Once upon a time”.   Jooki is a music player with a simple, intuitive user interface for all ages. Jooki is a standalone jukebox that plays from on-board storage and also a wireless speaker that streams from the phone or the cloud.The Jooki Stars make Jooki shine. The Stars are figurines and tokens that start a playlist (song, story, album or internet radio station). Perfect for kids: they simply place a Star on Jooki to choose what they want to listen to.The parents app isn’t required to play music but lets you stay in control and upload the music you want to share with the family.Easy & Fun - Simply place a Star on Jooki to play the music you want.    Listening to music or stories has never been so easy and fun! Kids love the independence Jooki gives them. They get to choose the music and stories to listen to without having to ask an adult for help. And with no screen in sight, kids listen and play without distractions.   The Jooki Stars are beautiful figurines and practical tokens that can be linked to your children’s favorite playlists.The figurines are fun, colourful characters and easy for small hands to grasp. The tokens are flat with fun designs (or use your own stickers). Both types of Star work exactly the same way and have suction cups so they don’t fall off Jooki.  Managing music on Jooki is easy
Choose the music you want to listen to. You can upload music from your phone using the Jooki app or drag-and-drop from iTunes on your laptop. You can also choose a Spotify playlist or an internet radio station.
Create a playlist (or have Jooki create one for you).
Choose the Star you want to link to the playlist and put it on Jooki. Done.
A playlist is one or more songs, stories, albums, or online radio stations.  Kids love to be in control of the world and Jooki gives them this independent access to their music and stories. At the same time the parents app lets you set boundaries. You choose when the kids can use Jooki and the media available on the device. You can set the maximum volume and you can always use the app as a remote control. The app is free and easy to use!  Jooki is designed for demanding children, but as parents ourselves, we demand quality, safety and ease of use. Jooki works on-the-go, bedroom or living room, inside or outside and of course it sounds great! In the box - 1x Jooki, 1x Figurine Star, 5x Token Stars, 1x charging cable  You will be able to choose your figurine type(s) after the campaign; we'll send you an email.  Founding Team - Theo, Will & PieterTheo MarescauxTheo was the Product Manager for 40% of the world’s digital cinema projectors that show movies to millions of people around the world. His new mission is to delight children with a 21st century music experience.Will MoffatWill has been programming and designing hardware since the age of 7, when he built his own computer alarm system to catch Santa Claus. He also worked at Google on Search, presumably still searching for Santa.Pieter PalmersPieter likes to disassemble gadgets, spin records, play music and has always been fascinated by audio technology. He led a team at Huawei working on next generation wireless chips for 5G smart phones and base stations.Founding Team carrying Early Test Audience Extended TeamThanks go out to
Guillermo & Ruth - Jooki Spain
Yves - Thanks for the amazing job on the video!
Martin, Martina, Filip - Thanks for helping us have great pictures!
Jimi - Thanks for the cool visuals!
Koen Vingerhoets - Crowdfunding ninja skills
Paul, Jan, Henry - Marketing advice
Samit, Annissa - Thanks for helping us with online marketing!
Riso, Andy, Will, Lewie, Cynthia - Thanks for prototyping support!
Danny, Jean-Marc, Marush, Lenka
Special Js - Jo, Joke, Johana
MembershipsPrototyping JookiThe early daysPrototyping modern Jooki Jooki comes packed with modern technology (which fades into the background where it belongs). 
Wifi 802.11b/g/n 
Bluetooth 4 Smart Ready
MicroSD Card Connector for Offline storage
Music Formats Supported : MP3, AAC, OGG, FLAC, WAV, AIFF 
Streaming Services: possible but subject to licensing deals
App: Android, iOS, HTML5 (for Windows Phone, PC & Mac) 
Charging: MicroUSB (charging cable included)
3.5mm headphones jack
Battery : 1800mAh (8hrs play time) 
Dimensions: 175 x 175 x 70mm
Weight: <700g (TBD)
Splash-proof (but not fully waterproof)
 We’ve added an estimated $10 shipping cost to every order. Because our backers can be all over the world we ship directly from Hong Kong. You will be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.We are working on local distribution channels to reduce shipping cost. Any progress on this will be put in our regular updates.Estimated delivery is September 2017.Risks and challengesBringing a physical product to life is challenging, even more so when it’s a children's product. To address this challenge we’ve been working with top manufacturers of both toys and audio products on product design, sourcing and scheduling. We have explicitly chosen not to take risks on production techniques, materials or components to avoid manufacturing and sourcing issues.Notwithstanding the margin in our timeline and the confidence we have in ourselves and our partners, we see the following points where delay could accrue: 
Safety concerns 
Quality concerns 
Hiccups in the regulatory approval 
Financial risks
We are determined to make Jooki a quality product and also ship as promised. We will keep our backers well informed, should we encounter hurdles.

story:
TAKE YOUR AUDIO EXPERIENCE TO THE NEXT LEVEL, NO STRINGS ATTACHED.

Audio lovers, musicians, DJs, everyone - hear your music on the Volcano and be blown away by the audio quality and rich bass.



Compact enough to travel with, bring to the party or barbecue...while packing the punch of a traditional entertainment center for a fraction of the price.


Frustrated with the common problem with Bluetooth speakers, little or no bass...

We decided to create an entirely new type of speaker that not only sounds great but also gives you the option to get that bigger kick.

You can now attach the Volcano speaker to its base containing an amazing bass sub-woofer. Press play and be ready for an audio explosion to hear your music the way it's meant to be heard.


The Volcano is an epiphany in wireless Bluetooth audio speaker design and rich audio quality.

Use the Volcano separately, or attach it to its base to hear your favorite music with a full dynamic audio range.

We designed and built it to give you the option to add an awesome bass sub-woofer.

Press play and be ready for an audio explosion to hear your music the way it's meant to be heard.


Enjoy the freedom. No longer is your phone, tablet or other device chained to your speakers.

No cords to get tangled or lost. Enjoy the party. No need to leave your phone behind or have it accidentally picked up.


Volcano works on all devices, whether it be a mobile phone (iOs, Android or Windows), tablet, laptop, Smart TV etc. Simply connect via Bluetooth.

Why we invented the Volcano.

A common problem we kept hearing with all the other small and different sized wireless bluetooth speakers is no bass or not enough of it. How can we listen to our favorite tracks without the bass?

The Volcano taking shape in an early design drawing:

So we set out to develop an entirely new type of wireless bluetooth speaker with more bass. Along the way in the creative development process, a number of fun and innovative milestones were achieved, including the new shape and design of the speaker. The Volcano was born!

How we invented the Volcano and why it works so well...

Frustrated with the common problem with bluetooth speakers - either little or no bass - we decided to create an entirely new type of speaker that not only sounds great but also gives you the option to get that bigger kick. Realizing our idea to reality was a lot of fun and led to a number of creative highlights along the way.

Early beginnings of the project dubbed the inverted muffin.

Our concept was to create a two part wireless audio system comprised of a mini bluetooth speaker that could be attached on top of a base stand housing a sub-woofer speaker to work together. The idea was to give the listener the option to take their audio experience to the next level at any time, or to utilize the top speaker separately with its own excellent audio quality. 

We started with a standard cylindrical shaped top speaker with some interesting shapes for the bottom speaker design ensuing during the early parts of the development, including the above inverted muffin shape.

Early concept hand drawings of the Volcano.

Unimpressed with the audio quality of the early prototypes, we went back to the drawing board and re-thought the development process to focus first and foremost on the highest attainable audio quality. 

We recruited the best audio engineers and experts, and re-thought the industrial and mechanical designs. We kept testing and re-testing for maximum audio fidelity, experiencing a dramatic boost in the audio output. We not only set our attention on the base, but were also inspired to try a trapezoidal shape for the top part.

Our idea for a trapezoidal shape of the top speaker led to a familiar resemblance.

After heavy development and prototyping work, we think we nailed the result which we're now proud to share with you. Simply put, the Volcano sounds awesome and we can't wait for you to have one.

A few photos of the prototypes.

Volcano is great for use indoors & outdoors and is extremely durable.


Volcano Top Speaker.

Volcano Bottom Speaker.


Funding Goal

The Volcano shown on this page is our fully working prototype.  With your support, we will manufacture the Volcano and deliver it to your doorstep.  The funding goal of $50,000 is necessary for manufacturing costs allocated towards:

  • Production costs (Molds, tooling, assembly, components, quality control)
  • Packaging and peripherals
  • Electronics certifications
  • Distribution to end users

We want everyone to experience the Volcano first hand.  Therefore we have allocated our own budget towards non-manufacturing costs related to the production of Volcano including R&D, design, development, project management, logistics, support, and risks of production and financial risks.  

Production Plan

We have lined up excellent manufacturing partners, and will deliver the Volcano according to the schedule in the campaign.  Upon funding of this IndieGoGo campaign, we will proceed to manufacturing the first Volcano units. 

Because we have already completed the prototype stage, we are in the position to shorten the manufacturing cycle and deliver the units in the shortest possible time according to the schedule.  Additional minor project tasks to be completed include product improvement tweaks, packaging design, quality control, and detailed user manual creation.

Our passion is development, production and manufacturing.  We have manufactured significant number of products and components in the past and have always met or exceeded our production timetables.  We know the nature of the challenges we may encounter and how to overcome them.  We look forward to communicating with you, and can't wait for you to get your own Volcano.

Thank you!

< < A special thanks to Sir Ivan whose song La La Land appears in our video, download the song here: https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/la-la-land-3/id698774307 > >

Our Team

Our team is committed to excellence in consumer electronics manufacturing.  We are comprised of industrial, electrical and computer engineers, as well as consumer product specialists and production managers, located in the USA, Asia, and Europe. Over the years our team has worked for Philips Electronics, IBM, AMD, Spansion, ASML, and CraneCo.  We have a passion for fun, innovative products and an expertise in wireless systems and technologies.

story:
Reviews!

1. Gamesky Review Note 20:

 
 

One look at Note 20, you are immediately reminded of the simple and useful Post-it note. Note 20 shares its pleasing and familiar shape as well as its helpful features: it’s a reminder, a helper, and a communicator. Our hope is that like a Post-it, Note 20 becomes a useful part of your day too! It’s helpful, reliable, and brings the exciting world of sound to you.

 

 

Ergonomic design and compact size makes Note 20 extremely comfortable. With a thickness of only 13.55 mm, this unique flat design improves fit and comfort especially for long listening sessions. Unlike other earbuds on the market, Note 20 earbuds have a low-profile fit that doesn’t protrude too far out of the ear. In fact, the earbuds cannot be seen from behind when worn my most people. 

 

Ultimately thin! The see-through structure of the Note 20 case lets you immediately see the current status of your earbuds, whether they are charging, in shut-down mode, or removed from the case. When Note 20 is lying on your desk, it’s a reminder for you to take a relaxing music break.

The Note 20 earbuds in the case are only 1/3rd the size of an iPhone 11 Pro Max. They are compact and small enough to fit in any pocket or purse.

 

 

A combination of comfort and freedom. We solved the problem of typical earbuds – resulting in comfortable long time use, fit, and in-ear depth.

 

The innovative dual zone fixation mode provides a firm and secure fit. You can adjust the best wearing angle by simply rotating the earbuds to achieve the best fit for your unique ear-canal shape.

 

asymmetrically designed to fit perfectly in either ear. The front surface and sides of the ear tip meet up perfectly with the ear canal, so you won’t get a foreign object sensation, pressure or discomfort. You will feel safe and comfy instead.

 

For earbuds to be truly comfortable for a long listening sessions, the way they fit in the ear canal is crucial. Earbuds that extend too far into the ear can cause pain, itching and a heavy feel. Others, such as Airpods that rest too far outside the ear, suffer from compromised sound quality. Note 20 did exhaustive testing and refinement for an ergonomic patented ‘short in-ear’ design that gives ultimate comfort, seals perfectly and delivers better sound.

 

Note 20 delivers premium sound with minimal audio delay for a powerful, immersive listening experience. They redefine the mobile audio experience with an exceptional design and cutting-edge audio technology. With 4-4.5 hours play time, you can embrace music world freely.

 

The design is focused on a premium appearance. The first spraying layer is for eye-catching color, the second is a pearl aluminum powder that gives Note 20 a special metal texture, the final matte paint finish adds deeper texture to it. The result is a stunning bright look from afar with subtle details up close.


We offer 4 colors for Note 20. The Coral Orange is for the young and passionate. The Christmas Green is subtle and comfortable. The Pearl White has a pure and clean look. The Classic Black is calm and steady. You can choose the color that best suits your mood.

 

With the strong magnetic built-in and the transparent structure, you will never lose your Note 20.

 

The square charging case and asymmetric design of Note 20 is stunningly different. The project earned a Red Dot award for its design concept and was recognized by the International Design Excellence Awards for its unique industrial design.

Patent protected unique structure makes taking out and putting back earbuds more fun than ever. Push Note 20 out is as easy as pushing a window, open up the music world for you anytime anywhere.

 

Note 20 has a simple touch control system to control music and calls at the touch of a button.

Your premium sound experience is ready to go anytime you are with a wireless charging design that provides 4.5 hours of sweet musical bliss after only 1 hour charging time.

Note 20 is ready to take on any adventure with you. They are IPX4 water resistant to protect from weather, sweat, harsh environments and dust while maintain high performance during any activity.

 

 

Lenovo is Fortune Global 500 company with a $ 50 billion market value, has more than 57,000 employees and offers products and services to 180+ countries and areas. 

Lenovo decided to collect Yobybo as a regenerative co-branding product series, Yobybo × Lenovo Note 20 series. The collaboration is believed to be more conductive to the original backers of Yobybo Note 20 series. Lenovo will assist Yobybo with their responsive logistics management capability, professional supply chain management capability and strict quality control. On the other hand, Yobybo will still insist to bring our excellent and advanced product ideas to users. Therefore, Yobybo × Lenovo Note 20 series are expected to bring better products and services to all backers.

Here at Yobybo, we have years of experience in design, manufacture and delivery of smart wearable. We have a history of successful crowdfunding projects and we are here to do it again in a bigger and better way to bring you the next generation of our wireless audio earbuds.

Yobybo X 2020 CES

Note 20 caught huge attention during the last 2020 CES.

 

 Accessorize your Note 20 with leather earbuds pouch and wireless charger.

 

 

 

 

We've already started mass production this month, will try our best deliver to all our backers within this month! A peak at our production line:
