You can have multiple friends in your chat and be in communication with everyone at the same time.The app will run in the background, only picking up on what you are saying when you hit the push-to-talk button on the SlimRemote. The Co-Pilot app uses your phones LTE capability to allow for unlimited range. No matter the distance you will be able to stay connected with your riding buddies at all times.   Zero Distraction ControlsControls at the tip of your fingers, the SlimRemote connects via latest Bluetooth technology to your device and allows you to control your audio, pick up phone calls, and activate voice commands all while riding. The SlimRemote is carefully designed to minimize distraction on the road. Inspired by the traditional lever design it allows for control without lifting your hand off the handlebar.Push-To-TalkWhile connected to the EAOS Co-Pilot app, you can talk to your friends with just the click of a button, using the SlimRemote. The SlimRemote features a push-to-talk button for riders to communicate with ease.Water ResistantIn the case of unpredictable weather, EAOS has you covered. We built the SlimRemote to be water resistant so it can accompany you when you get caught in the rain.   SlimBuds are powered by one of the smallest and most powerful sound drivers, delivering deep lows for immense bass and clear highs for crisp treble. We source our sound drivers from a company that has decades of experience in delivering superior audio quality. The SlimBuds battery is designed to last even during the longest of rides. It pumps out a reliable 6 hours of play time to accompany you everywhere. Our charging port is standard Micro-USB, which means less cable confusion.We have 2 microphones integrated into the design of the SlimBuds. The first mic is dedicated to the rider's communication. The second mic is solely dedicated to listening to the environment. This data is transferred via a powerful CSR chip through a bluetooth connection in real time to your phone within a thousandth of a second. This is where the Co-Pilot app picks up to assist the rider with crucial sounds.     We're proud to have SlimBuds fans all over the world! We will ship the SlimBuds worldwide, with the exception of Argentina, Belarus, Cuba, Iran, Iraq, Lebanon, Libya, Myanmar/Burma, North Korea, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, and Yemen. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

story:
GET is the first truly portable 24-bit wireless headphone amplifier.

With its compact, elegant design and powerful amplification, GET is the perfect solution for music lovers wanting to use their wired headphones with the recent jack-less smartphones from Apple and others and enjoy both the benefits of high quality sound and the practicality of wireless. 

GET brings a solution that is the best of both worlds. It’s small, light and will drive any headphones beautifully, wirelessly. 

 

Our Guarantee

Your headphones will sound better plugged into GET than plugged directly in your phone.

Don't take our word for it. Experience it yourself. GET brings your music to life. This is true with any wired headphones and any music files. If you don't find that there is a noticeable benefit with GET, return it for a full refund. That's how confident we are with our product.

 

Using GET is super easy

Plug-in your headphones to GET and pair it to your smartphone via Bluetooth, NFC pairing works too. Once paired, you can enjoy music with the highest level of clarity, answer phone calls thanks to the integrated high quality MEMS microphone, control your music with the play/pause/shuffle buttons and adjust volume without ever having to handle your phone.

Headphones, just like speakers, need to be driven, so there’s a (tiny) amplifier in every smartphone but it’s not powerful enough to properly drive your headphones. You may not realize it, but you’ve probably never heard the full potential of your beloved cans.

GET can also turn any home sound system into a high performance wireless audio platform.

GET supports all existing codecs for Bluetooth transmission, including AAC, AptX and the upcoming 24-bit AptX-HD. It also supports EDR (Enhanced Data Rate). Forget what you know or heard so far with basic Bluetooth devices, this is just in another league.

 

The Story

or why your wired headphones are NOT obsolete.

I’m Pierre, music lover, audiophile, and engineer. Like a lot of you, I’ve become more and more frustrated to be told that my great hi-fi gear (which works perfectly well) is outdated, that the Almighty Technology Spirit just wants me to replace it with something else, not something better, just something compatible. I’ve got wired headphones which I love, and I don’t want to throw them away in the “obsolete” bin. The best cans out there are wired, and I want to be able to use them and enjoy them.

Tip, ring and sleeve. The technology behind the headphone jack goes all the way back to 1878.  A glorious century and a half of reliable audio connections, and a vibrant and historical case of « If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it » 

When I started hearing rumours about Apple dropping the audio jack on their next phone I thought it was enough, we have one standard, we’ve had it for over a century and it works with everything. I didn’t know how to fix this, but I had a feeling something could be done.

As luck has it, the greatest product designer I know, Stephane, also happens to be my brother-in-law and he lives right downstairs. We started brainstorming on the best way for us to keep enjoying our (wired) gear with a device/product/invention/whatever that would also make use of leading edge technology. 

Our family project developed well and Bluewave was born, and here we are, asking you to contribute and help us make our dream a reality. We’re really proud of what we’ve accomplished and our greatest joy is when people try GET for the first time, go wide eyed, start to smile and say: "Wow, this sounds so much BETTER!".

 

The Iphone7 conundrum

Apple’s new IPhone7 has no jack and everyone’s wondering how it will work with their existing headphones. Sure, Apple provides a dongle adapter to make do but your headphones deserve better. We honestly think GET is a far more elegant, practical and useful way to go forward. If you have wired headphones and want to connect them to your brand new Iphone, here are your choices:

 

Specifications

 

GET's intelligent RGB LED gives feedback so you always know about the pairing state, battery status and the type of Codec used.

 

GET’s App!

Get comes with a great companion app for Android and iOS. You will be able to access many controls:

An awesome equalizer to personalize GET’s tone, visual feedback for the battery charge level and the Bluetooth signal, an option to turn the LED off and many more settings, including the ability to do firmware updates.

 

 

Featured in

 

Testimonials

“It’s like listening to the same song but straight from the recording studio”
-Bruno Gugglielminetti (Canoe.ca)


"The difference in sound quality between the regular sound and the sound amplified by GET is audible right away and frankly impressive "

-Sarah-Emilie Nault (Le Huffington post)
 

 

Accessories

Our “Headset Mount Accessory Pack” includes a high quality ultra-short cable with either a 3.5mm or 2.5mm plug and a purpose built Headphone Clip. It’s available in limited quantity at a very special “end of campaign” price of $9.00 USD, a 40% savings on the $14.99 retail price!

 

GEEK CORNER!

A long, dry and technical explanation of what we love to do.

So, yes, we’re saying: «your headphones will sound BETTER plugged into GET than plugged directly into your smartphone». We know, it’s a bold statement. You’re probably thinking: Wait a minute, since when Bluetooth with its different Codecs that all use compression can sound better than audio travelling through a wire? We agree, you are right! It’s normally not the case.

If you listen to lossless files like FLACs those will go through a lossy compression algorithm before they reach GET. That’s unavoidable considering the absolute maximum of 768 Kbps in the audio distribution profile of Bluetooth 4.2. 

So it comes down to just this: The benefits are greater than the cost. Whether or not the degradation in a low ratio compression can be heard is still a debate and is hard to measure. We are not talking about 128 kbps files here, which are horrible, good quality rips -whether it’s AAC or Mp3- will be left untouched and reproduced in all their glory, at the maximum bitrate supported by your source device.

So back to our original claim, how did we manage to achieve it? Well we don’t have control over the Bluetooth protocol (although we use it to its maximum potential) but what we do have control on is everything else that makes a good sounding device. You might have been disappointed with audio quality of Bluetooth devices, that’s where know-how and quality components come into play.

So there you have it: the main reason it sounds better is because the gain in sound quality from a well designed, dedicated amplifier compared to what’s in your phone has more impact than the theoretical bitrate loss   GET offers many electronic design features that would be expected in devices many times its cost:

1 : Fully differential signal path.

What that means is that any noise picked up by the antenna or internally by the electronics will be rejected by the amplification circuit. In some ways it works similarly to what is more common to the end user: a balanced cable. There are a few differences that I won’t go through here but what it basically does is that the left and right audio signal each are appearing twice to the input of the amplifier, but with an inverted polarity. Since noise is normally common in both conductors, the added noise can be detected and rejected. We’re over-simplifying here, but the bottom line is: it works, you don’t want noise polluting that amazing song right?

2 :  No capacitors in the audio signal.

Capacitors in an audio path degrade audio and increase the harmonic distortion (THD) in a measurable way.  The small ceramic capacitors that are usually present in a miniature design like that are actually the worst, but that’s actually the most convenient way to remove a residual DC voltage in the signal. We didn’t go the easy way. For us audiophiles, capacitors are evil, so we managed to just not have DC. We never settled with putting a cap there and call it done. We were dedicated and optimised our circuit: we did it with proper power planes isolation and components that talk well with each other.

3 : State of the art star grounding scheme.  

That’s where the real art is, there is no textbook procedure to good grounding. Yes there are generalities, like separating digital and analog ground but even that is not properly implemented in most low cost Bluetooth device we tested, and that’s just the tip of the Iceberg. Ground is the reference against which we base our signal, but more importantly it’s the return path for current. We can’t stress that enough: Grounding must be thoroughly thought of as it influences the whole circuit layout. Residual voltages on ground and currents in unwanted areas of the circuit means improper audio bias, channel imbalance, audio crosstalk, bad reception, noise problems, etc. The list could go on and we’ve seen all kinds of things.  We’re not taking this lightly. We’ve created a beautifully crafted network that insures the audio signal travels the way we want it, with nothing added to it.

4 Digital to analog conversion

We can’t take much credit here, but can certainly tell you that in terms of conversion embedded in a wireless chip, we went straight to Qualcomm/CSR’s flagship: the CSR8675. That’s the component that receives the digital signal from the antenna and outputs the analog audio signal. This component is expensive but it’s worth every penny. As of today, it’s the only Bluetooth controller that allows 24 bit audio and its integrated DAC performs very well.

By doing things right and never cutting corners, we can give you a sound clarity unheard of before in this type of device. You’ll get to experience amazingly low distortion, and virtually no noise for a completely black Background with the punchy and fast bass that proper amplification can bring. You’ll hear details in your music you didn’t know where there.

Prototype development

 

The Team

Bluewave is a Montreal-based company that offers affordable wireless high-fidelity audio products. Bluewave was founded in March 2016 by Pierre Lelièvre and Stéphane Lepage who won several design awards. Together they bring in 40 years experience in audio, product development and design.

 

 

The Project

 

The funds of this campaign will be used to finance the productions costs: certification, tooling and manufacturing.

 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q. What happens if you don’t reach your full funding goal?

A. We are going forward no matter the amount raised through Indiegogo. Funding for the project come from various sources, crowdfunding is one of them. We fully intend to keep all promises of delivery.

Q.Is it possible to use GET while charging?

A. Yes absolutely, you can even keep it plugged all the time for home use without ever using the battery.

Q. Does the GET’s microphone have noise cancelling?

A. Yes, GET integrates a technology called CvC for clear voice call. It is the best noise cancelling technology available for Bluetooth devices.

Q. Does GET support external microphone (headphones with integrated mic)?

A. Yes GET will detect an external microphone and use this one instead of our integrated one.

Q. Is it possible to use GET with wireless earbuds?

A. No, GET is designed to work with wired headphones. It would be technically impossible to use our amplification circuit for headphones that are already wireless.

Q. Can you use the micro USB port as a digital audio input?

A. No, this would require a dedicated circuit that would increase the size and the price of GET. GET is designed to be used wirelessly but doesn’t compromise on sound quality.

 

Risk and Challenges

We have functional prototypes and have preliminary agreements with tooling and production facilities here in Canada. Our next step is to finalize and prepare everything that’s needed for production (certifications, tooling, etc.) The road that brings us to the delivery date of April has been carefully analysed and we are very confident that Get will be pumping your favorite tunes next spring as promised.

We thank you for your trust and support. By contributing to our campaign you are in fact part of the adventure, part of the Bluewave family.

Media Kit

story:
Deeply impacted by the tragedy of losing his late-wife Jennifer to brain cancer in 2013, Steven created ROAM, Inc. to blend his expertise in audio with a desire to make mobile devices safer to use. 

ROPES USA are the creative, colorful special edition debut of ROAM ROPES – the world’s first fully-integrated, wearable, Bluetooth earphones with companion amplifier and audio personalization app. The best-sounding and most customizable earphones on the market today, ROPES USA are now available for the first time.

Every ear has its own unique “fingerprint” – or “sound signature,” if you will. No one sound fits all ears. Not even close. That’s why we give you your own EQ.

EQs work in ranges, or “bands.” They let you “cut” and “boost” the high and low ranges of sound – commonly referred to as “treble” and “bass.” Thanks to the ROAM EQ app, you get five full bands of sound to work with. Plus DSP functionality that includes dynamic bass boost, spectral effect, and a preamp gain.

With the ROAM EQ app, you also get some brilliant presets – each one custom-created and crafted for a different genre of music. These aren’t your standard earphone presents. These are carefully, creatively custom-crafted settings that allow you to match your music with your moods. And change the way you experience your music. From song to song. From artist to artist. From album to album. And beyond. It’s all up to you.

Superior sound. Sleek style. Comfortable fit. Colorful looks. ROPES USA offers its wearers all of these features and more, including the ability to customize your listening experience like never before.

The brilliantly designed device fits seamlessly around your neck – and into your daily routine. Say goodbye to bulky headphones and tangled wires. And say hello to the ultimate audio experience as you SET SOUND FREE with ROPES USA.

The Bluetooth-enabled earphones feature a fully-integrated amplifier and audio equalizer that can be easily and quickly customized using the ROAM EQ mobile app. By allowing users to adjust audio frequencies in their ROPES, ROAM EQ empowers listeners to declare audio independence from the tyranny of the standard “one sound fits all” listening experience. Customize your sound based on how you want to hear it. Or use the pre-set functions on ROAM EQ to hear your favorite music the way each individual artist intended it to be heard, felt, lived, and loved. 

For You:

ROAM and ROPES USA were created not only for U.S. Olympians and U.S. service men and women, but for each and every American who loves and appreciates music. Our goal is not just to develop and market the world’s greatest wireless, wearable earphones – but to reintroduce the world to the fine art of sound. To accomplish these lofty goals, we need your support. Not just to fund our efforts, but to spread the word and share the sweet sounds (and look and feel) of ROPES USA. We’ve completed the design and testing for ROPES USA, and are heading into the manufacturing phase. This period includes final testing and evaluation, packaging, and final product validation. Manufacturing costs of our world-class and innovative earphones are extremely high. We need your help to make it through this phase. If this sounds good to you, we’ve got even more music to your ears. We’re offering a wide array of fantastic giveaways to donors of various levels.


 For USA Olympians:

Inspired by and created for elite U.S.A. athletes, the ROPES USA project was launched in January 2016. ROAM founder Steven Lamar created this special patriotic edition of his popular ROPES earphones because of his admiration for Olympians.  Throughout his life, Steven has drawn motivation from Olympians' perseverance, strength and commitment to excellence.  He set out to create a USA-themed version of ROPES earphones to honor the athletes that inspire him.  

Steven’s vision was to leverage the superior audio experience and personalization abilities of the world’s most powerful wireless earphones – into a sporty, sleek, cool, colorful version of ROPES. ROPES USA will be worn and rocked by U.S.A. athletes in Brazil this summer. By participating in this fundraising campaign, you can proudly don your own pair. It’s the next best thing to hanging an Olympic medal around your neck. 

For Stand Up To Cancer:

Elite-level athletes weren’t the only inspiration for ROPES. Deeply impacted by the tragedy of losing his late-wife Jennifer to brain cancer, Steven created ROPES to blend his expertise in audio with a desire to make mobile devices safer to use.   In memory of Jennifer, ROAM will donate $5,000 to Stand Up To Cancer upon the completion of this campaign. Please note that no funds raised through this campaign will be used to fund this donation.  If you would like to learn more about Steven's personal story and his commitment to raising funds for cancer research, please read his letter in the "Updates" section of this campaign.



 


Artist Sound Signatures:

Sound is a musician’s art form, but today’s ordinary earphones only allow listeners to hear music one way – the way the audio engineers decide for you. We value the art of music. And the unique talent it takes to create it. So we created a premium mobile audio platform to reproduce sound that’s true to the artist’s intention. And we partnered with new and established artists alike to create their own unique Artist Sound Signatures for ROAM and USA ROPES users. Starting in the fall of 2016, ROAM users can download an Artist Sound Signature directly to their ROAM EQ app – connecting them to the artist and their recordings in a way that has never been heard or felt before.

 Superior Sound:

We all hear differently, and no one sound fits all listeners. The ROAM EQ Companion App liberates listeners from the tyranny of the ordinary “one sound fits all” experience. It empowers music lovers like you to control the EQ in your USA ROPES via Bluetooth – and to customize the sound as you desire for the music you love. ROAM EQ also features pre-set EQ’s for various musical genres – offering a quick and easy path to audio customization.

 Creative Design:

ROPES USA were designed by San Francisco-based Astro Studios. For more than 20 years, Astro has helped companies like Nike, Xbox, Neff Watches, and The Art of Shaving make stuff that people love. Wearable. Functional. Simple. Different. ROPES USA is all of this and more. You wear it around your neck, like a piece of jewelry. It’s always there when you want it. And it looks great when you don’t need it.

 

Comfortable Fit:

The angle, fit, and seal of the capsule in your ear is critical to comfort and sound quality. The ROPES USA ear capsule fit was engineered by Knowles, a 65-year-old company dedicated to performance audio in consumer electronics – and best known for miniature microphone and receiver technology for the hearing-impaired. These guys know a lot about earphones. We leverage their incredible data, insight, and experience to bring you the best fit and feel.

 Cutting-Edge Tech:

ROPES USA are powered by ROAM's EQ Engine – a pendant that houses a powerful 28-bit, 50-MIPS processor and ultra-low noise, high-performance 24-bit stereo DAC. The signal-to-noise ratio is an exceptional 98dB. Sensitivity is incredible at 105dB @ 1KHz. Audio distortion is non-existent. The 10mm direct radiating base driver delivers ultra-low distortion audio from 15 Hz - 4KHz, while the balance armature transducers provide the upper mid-range and high frequencies from 4KHz to beyond 20KHz. This amplifier, Bluetooth, and battery compartment serves as the power behind the exceptional audio that is delivered by our hybrid earphones and it is the hardware core that supports our ROAM EQ audio personalization app. 

Key Features:

  • Lightweight, wearable, tangle-free design 
  • ROAM SureFIT ear tips in various sizes 
  • Hands-free calling and music controls 
  • iOS- and Android-compatible   

 

 Packaging:
story_txt:
Deeply impacted by the tragedy of losing his late-wife Jennifer to brain cancer in 2013, Steven created ROAM, Inc. to blend his expertise in audio with a desire to make mobile devices safer to use. 
ROPES USA are the creative, colorful special edition debut of ROAM ROPES – the world’s first fully-integrated, wearable, Bluetooth earphones with companion amplifier and audio personalization app. The best-sounding and most customizable earphones on the market today, ROPES USA are now available for the first time.






Every ear has its own unique “fingerprint” – or “sound signature,” if you will. No one sound fits all ears. Not even close. That’s why we give you your own EQ.
EQs work in ranges, or “bands.” They let you “cut” and “boost” the high and low ranges of sound – commonly referred to as “treble” and “bass.” Thanks to the ROAM EQ app, you get five full bands of sound to work with. Plus DSP functionality that includes dynamic bass boost, spectral effect, and a preamp gain.





With the ROAM EQ app, you also get some brilliant presets – each one custom-created and crafted for a different genre of music. These aren’t your standard earphone presents. These are carefully, creatively custom-crafted settings that allow you to match your music with your moods. And change the way you experience your music. From song to song. From artist to artist. From album to album. And beyond. It’s all up to you.





Superior sound. Sleek style. Comfortable fit. Colorful looks. ROPES USA offers its wearers all of these features and more, including the ability to customize your listening experience like never before.
The brilliantly designed device fits seamlessly around your neck – and into your daily routine. Say goodbye to bulky headphones and tangled wires. And say hello to the ultimate audio experience as you SET SOUND FREE with ROPES USA.





The Bluetooth-enabled earphones feature a fully-integrated amplifier and audio equalizer that can be easily and quickly customized using the ROAM EQ mobile app. By allowing users to adjust audio frequencies in their ROPES, ROAM EQ empowers listeners to declare audio independence from the tyranny of the standard “one sound fits all” listening experience. Customize your sound based on how you want to hear it. Or use the pre-set functions on ROAM EQ to hear your favorite music the way each individual artist intended it to be heard, felt, lived, and loved. 






For You:
ROAM and ROPES USA were created not only for U.S. Olympians and U.S. service men and women, but for each and every American who loves and appreciates music. Our goal is not just to develop and market the world’s greatest wireless, wearable earphones – but to reintroduce the world to the fine art of sound. To accomplish these lofty goals, we need your support. Not just to fund our efforts, but to spread the word and share the sweet sounds (and look and feel) of ROPES USA. We’ve completed the design and testing for ROPES USA, and are heading into the manufacturing phase. This period includes final testing and evaluation, packaging, and final product validation. Manufacturing costs of our world-class and innovative earphones are extremely high. We need your help to make it through this phase. If this sounds good to you, we’ve got even more music to your ears. We’re offering a wide array of fantastic giveaways to donors of various levels.







 For USA Olympians:
Inspired by and created for elite U.S.A. athletes, the ROPES USA project was launched in January 2016. ROAM founder Steven Lamar created this special patriotic edition of his popular ROPES earphones because of his admiration for Olympians.  Throughout his life, Steven has drawn motivation from Olympians' perseverance, strength and commitment to excellence.  He set out to create a USA-themed version of ROPES earphones to honor the athletes that inspire him.  
Steven’s vision was to leverage the superior audio experience and personalization abilities of the world’s most powerful wireless earphones – into a sporty, sleek, cool, colorful version of ROPES. ROPES USA will be worn and rocked by U.S.A. athletes in Brazil this summer. By participating in this fundraising campaign, you can proudly don your own pair. It’s the next best thing to hanging an Olympic medal around your neck. 







For Stand Up To Cancer: 
Elite-level athletes weren’t the only inspiration for ROPES. Deeply impacted by the tragedy of losing his late-wife Jennifer to brain cancer, Steven created ROPES to blend his expertise in audio with a desire to make mobile devices safer to use.   In memory of Jennifer, ROAM will donate $5,000 to Stand Up To Cancer upon the completion of this campaign. Please note that no funds raised through this campaign will be used to fund this donation.  If you would like to learn more about Steven's personal story and his commitment to raising funds for cancer research, please read his letter in the "Updates" section of this campaign.










 







Artist Sound Signatures:
Sound is a musician’s art form, but today’s ordinary earphones only allow listeners to hear music one way – the way the audio engineers decide for you. We value the art of music. And the unique talent it takes to create it. So we created a premium mobile audio platform to reproduce sound that’s true to the artist’s intention. And we partnered with new and established artists alike to create their own unique Artist Sound Signatures for ROAM and USA ROPES users. Starting in the fall of 2016, ROAM users can download an Artist Sound Signature directly to their ROAM EQ app – connecting them to the artist and their recordings in a way that has never been heard or felt before.





 Superior Sound:
We all hear differently, and no one sound fits all listeners. The ROAM EQ Companion App liberates listeners from the tyranny of the ordinary “one sound fits all” experience. It empowers music lovers like you to control the EQ in your USA ROPES via Bluetooth – and to customize the sound as you desire for the music you love. ROAM EQ also features pre-set EQ’s for various musical genres – offering a quick and easy path to audio customization.





 Creative Design:
ROPES USA were designed by San Francisco-based Astro Studios. For more than 20 years, Astro has helped companies like Nike, Xbox, Neff Watches, and The Art of Shaving make stuff that people love. Wearable. Functional. Simple. Different. ROPES USA is all of this and more. You wear it around your neck, like a piece of jewelry. It’s always there when you want it. And it looks great when you don’t need it.





 
Comfortable Fit:
The angle, fit, and seal of the capsule in your ear is critical to comfort and sound quality. The ROPES USA ear capsule fit was engineered by Knowles, a 65-year-old company dedicated to performance audio in consumer electronics – and best known for miniature microphone and receiver technology for the hearing-impaired. These guys know a lot about earphones. We leverage their incredible data, insight, and experience to bring you the best fit and feel.





 Cutting-Edge Tech:
ROPES USA are powered by ROAM's EQ Engine – a pendant that houses a powerful 28-bit, 50-MIPS processor and ultra-low noise, high-performance 24-bit stereo DAC. The signal-to-noise ratio is an exceptional 98dB. Sensitivity is incredible at 105dB @ 1KHz. Audio distortion is non-existent. The 10mm direct radiating base driver delivers ultra-low distortion audio from 15 Hz - 4KHz, while the balance armature transducers provide the upper mid-range and high frequencies from 4KHz to beyond 20KHz. This amplifier, Bluetooth, and battery compartment serves as the power behind the exceptional audio that is delivered by our hybrid earphones and it is the hardware core that supports our ROAM EQ audio personalization app. 





Key Features:

Lightweight, wearable, tangle-free design 
ROAM SureFIT ear tips in various sizes 
Hands-free calling and music controls 
iOS- and Android-compatible   






 







 Packaging:





 





 
Get Your Project Funded Today!
 
Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love!

story:
Hey!

We are a four piece Instrumental Post Rock band from Rugby, Warwickshire. UK.

Our music means so much to us, providing us with an escape from reality, no matter how brief. With your contributions we can achieve so much, to create a piece of art, for our art, something we believe in!

Crowdfunding helps bands and other projects like this to stand up and get started on the path to success. Doing this independently means we have no financial back besides ourselves and YOU, it is a huge ask of us to ask you to contribute to something most of you havn't heard yet, but we fully believe in ourselves and  that our music will trigger something in you. 

What We Need & What You Get

Overall we need just over 600 pounds to press 250 vinyl records with artwork by the end of march.

Every contribution over 5 pounds will receive a Digital Download of our Debut EP '...And For A Moment, We Felt Free.'

Every contribution over 10 pounds will receive a Digital Download and one of the limited vinyl pressings with artwork of our Debut EP

At this stage we honestly don't have much else to offer but any contribution over 10 pounds, we will make sure the next record is for you guys!!

Risks & Challenges

You don't know us yet, but believe in us!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, no worries, you can still help us by spreading the word of what we are trying to do here and share this page far and wide!

Any help is never 'too small'

story:
Missed our campaign? You can order Pisound on https://blokas.io

Our main goal is to boost the Linux audio ecosystem and to bring the portable & affordable audio workstation to the hands of makers, thinkers and all the musicians out there. And thanks to your support we are able to accomplish that! Thank you very much!

 

Pisound is an ultra-low latency high-quality soundcard and MIDI interface specially designed for Raspberry Pi pocket computers. Equipped with 192kHz 24-bit stereo input and output driven by the legendary Burr-Brown chips, classic MIDI In and Out ports, user-customizable button and bundled software tools, this little board is an all-around solution for your Raspberry Pi based audio projects.

 

ASK.AUDIO, SYNTHTOPIA, SONICSTATE,
RASPBERRY PI WEEKLY, MUSICTECH,
MUSICRADAR, HACKADAY, GEARNEWS, ADSRSOUNDS, PALMSOUNDS, PIPOD, SOUNDGEARS,
GEEKY-GADGETS, SOUNDIUM,
WWWHATSNEW, FABCROSS,
EVERPI, ROOT.CZ,
NEWATLAS

 

 “If you currently use or plan to use Raspberry Pi for any audio/MIDI-based work or projects, and you need a quick, easy, and affordable solution for high quality and low latency audio, Pisound is the answer, and I thoroughly recommend it.” - Liam Lacey, ASK.AUDIO
(You can find the full review here)

“If you’re experimenting with Pure Data or any other Linux audio toy, this could be a useful addition to your Pi stack.” - Brian Benchoff, HACKADAY

  “The Blokas Pisound board looks exactly like the Raspberry Pi soundcard Sonic Pi has been dreaming about: Quality Audio/MIDI In & Out” - Sam Aaron, SONIC PI

 “Audio quality is very good. All my old problems of noise caused by bad cheap sound cards are gone.” - Tomme, BETA-TESTER

 

Pisound mounts directly onto Raspberry Pi via its 40-pin header, no additional power adapter, cables or soldering is required. Just use included spacers and screws to fasten it. After that, simply power up your Raspberry Pi, wait for it to boot, connect it to the Internet and enter a few commands in a terminal window:

wget http://blokas.io/pisound/install-pisound.sh -O install-pisound.sh
chmod +x install-pisound.sh
./install-pisound.sh

And that's it. Done. Thank You! Now you can choose pisound as your main sound card through native Volume widget and use it with any Linux Audio/MIDI software.

 

Pisound allows you to connect a huge variety of different types of audio-related gear. Thanks to the design of stereo input with wide-range gain control, you can connect audio sources ranging from your bass guitar to a CD player or your modular synth. Using stereo output you can hook Pisound to any mixer, speakers or just plug in your headphones. Volume and Gain levels can be controlled using on-board knobs. For MIDI connectivity you also have a lot of options - MIDI In/Out through on-board DIN-5 sockets, USB-MIDI via Pi's USB ports or even WiFi-MIDI!

 

When we were designing Pisound one of the main goals was to empower everyone to use Pisound and Raspberry Pi in headless mode - without an external monitor, keyboard or mouse. As it turns out, one button, is all you need to achieve this. We call it The Button. It single-handedly allows to perform multiple forms of interactions, such as single click, double click, triple click and hold.

Its functionality can be customized according to your needs. By default, using The Button you can open patches straight from a USB thumb drive, safely close them, shut down the Raspberry Pi and even launch “pisound” Wi-Fi hotspot, so that you can connect to the device via SSH, VNC or send WiFi-MIDI messages directly to your Pi using a smartphone or tablet.

Our favorite use-case for it - you can run your Pure Data patches, without any need to connect a display, keyboard or mouse, just by plugging in a USB drive containing “main.pd” file, any optional MIDI controller / keyboard, click The Button once and Voilà!

* Triple-click WiFi hotspot works with Raspberry Pi 3 & Zero W out of the box. Other versions require SoftAP capable USB WiFi adapter to be plugged in.

 

Make Your Own Instrument

Pisound in combination with Raspberry Pi provides you an easy and quick way to create your own instrument, e.g. digital synthesizer, effects unit, groovebox or sampler. You can use LV2 plugins, SuperCollider, Pure Data, Sonic Pi or any other Linux compatible audio application to take care of the software side of things and Pisound will do the rest.

The fastest way to create your own thing is to use Pure Data. Pure Data is a real-time graphical programming environment for audio and video that lets you generate and process audio signals in many different and magical ways. 

You can find pre-made patches on PatchStorage, write one of them to a USB drive, plug it into your Raspberry Pi, click the Pisound’s button once and enjoy! And if you want to get your hands dirty you can create your own patches too!

Liam Lacey from Ask.Audio shows how it goes. You can find his full review here.

 

Live Coding Jam-Session

Sam Aaron used Pisound for his Sonic Pi presentation and jam-session at this years' Raspberry Pi birthday party. Both the Guitar and Synth are connected to the stereo input of Pisound. 

 

Glove Controlled Voice Augmenter

Tomme, one of our beta-testers, used Pisound to finish his prototype of a glove controlled voice augmenter. The glove is made using Arduino, 2 buttons, 4 flex sensors, 1 XYZ accelerometer and Bluetooth transmitter. Pure Data is responsible for the sound processing.

 

Audiophile Network Player

Using Raspberry Pi + Pisound + Volumio/RuneAudio you can build your own Hi-Fi network player. Just connect it to your home stereo system and control it using any device running a web browser. You can find project instructions here.

 

Recording Studio

Pisound works great with Audacity - an open source, cross-platform audio software for multi-track recording and editing, so you can start recording your creations with just a few clicks.

 

Your Own Internet Radio Station

Have you ever dreamed to have your own radio station? Now you can! You just need to use Pisound, darkice and icecast with your Raspberry Pi. You can find project instructions here.

 

Meet Blokas Team - Justinas (guy in the tree), Giedrius (the one in the sky), Jatas (guy with the glasses), Šarūnas (the one that sings), Aida (the smiling one) and the one on a boat is Pranciškus. 

We love to make things and we love to talk about them, so if you have any questions, you can ask us in the comment section, on our community forums or even chat with us here!

If your question is more technical one, you can have a look at Pisound's documentation page here.

 

Over the past 18 months we went through 6 different hardware revisions until we have arrived at the current design. Some of the design options we’ve explored before was using the Raspberry Pi’s UART (RX/TX) pins directly for MIDI interface implementation, however we found that the MIDI 31250bps baud rate is not considered standard in Linux world, achieving it required tinkering with kernel configurations, depended on the CPU frequency, and methods to achieve serial communication using the MIDI baud rate were changing over time. A long term and reliable solution for this was needed, so we came up with the current solution that uses the Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) and a translator microcontroller for the MIDI interface.

In addition, we went through multiple power supply designs. For example in the previous revisions we used to have an external power connector. Thanks to the feedback from our beta testers, we found out that for them to get the right power adapter is going to be tricky and expensive compared to using official and highly available Raspberry Pi USB adapter. We adjusted our design and now Pisound is powered straight from the Raspberry Pi board itself. 

Currently we’re at the point where Pisound has reached a mature and stable state, successfully went through a beta test program, conforms to Raspberry Pi’s Hardware Attached on Top (HAT) specifications and is ready to reach the wider audience.

3D-printable case specially designed for Pisound. You can find all the necessary files here.

 

Pisound is compatible with virtually all Linux distributions and software as it comes with an ALSA audio and MIDI driver integrated in mainline Raspbian Linux kernel (ver. 4.4.27+). The pisound-btn daemon, which runs in the background, monitors and reacts to The Button. It uses next to no CPU time, as it executes instructions only when it receives interrupts raised by the kernel when the voltage level on the GPIO pin controlled by The Button position changes.

Thanks to the daemon, The Button triggers shell scripts when performing the following actions: single clicking; double clicking; triple clicking; holding the button down. The default scripts for the actions respectively do: start a Pure Data patch from connected USB drive; safely stop the patch and prepare the USB drive for removal; toggles WiFi Hotspot mode; safely shuts down the device.

 

Figure 1.  Response of the sine signal fed to loop-backed (digital→DAC→ADC→digital) Pisound showing the Signal-to-Noise Ratio (SNR) of 110 dB. Calculated Total Harmonic Distortion (THD) is less than 0.05%.

Figure 2. Frequency response of the white noise fed to loop-backed (digital→DAC→ADC→digital) Pisound showing the bandwidth (BW) of the device and how it is estimated.

The legendary Burr-Brown Op-Amps, ADC and DAC chips are brought together on this little board to exhibit clean signal amplification and conversion between digital and analog realms. The device exceeds HD-Audio standards thanks to its linear bit depth of 24 bits and maximum sample rate of 192 kHz.

Even though audio converters and other chips have a pretty good power supply rejection ratio (PSRR) on their own, to ensure low-noise operation in the vicinity of an electrically noisy Raspberry Pi computer, any power line going to the analog stuff is coupled via low dropout regulators (LDO’s) which filters any digital interference out. This design enables Pisound to be graded as a high-fidelity (Hi-Fi) audio device. For example a Hi-Fi device is expected to have the Total Harmonic Distortion value (THD) less than 1% and the Pisound has it less than 0.05% (fig. 1). That means that you can daisy-chain 20 Pisound boards and the chain would still be considered as a high-fidelity device!

We also measured the audio bandwidth of the device and as you can see (fig. 2) it is as flat as a proper table and shows -3dB high-pass and low-pass roll-off at 7.5Hz and 23kHz accordingly.

Another nice feature is a clip-LED - it will light up whenever the signal at the ADC input is too high and the gain should be lowered. Please see the specs table below for additional specifications of the device.

 

To satisfy your MIDI communication needs, Pisound has 3 options: DIN-5 Input and Output MIDI ports with activity LEDs, WiFi-MIDI and USB-MIDI via Raspberry Pi’s USB ports. Unlike usual MIDI solutions for Raspberry Pi, serial DIN-5 MIDI on Pisound is implemented using high speed SPI and a dedicated microcontroller for translating SPI data to serial MIDI byte streams and it's readily recognized in audio software as an ALSA MIDI device. The loopback latency of MIDI was measured to be 2.105ms. The two MIDI activity LEDs blink based on the flow of MIDI events.

In addition, Pisound lets you take advantage of WiFi-MIDI. When WiFi Hotspot mode is enabled via triple clicking The Button, touchosc2midi daemon gets launched. It translates OSC messages to MIDI events so you can control audio software running on Raspberry Pi from your smartphone or tablet.

And of course you can use USB-MIDI devices as usual by connecting them to Raspberry Pi USB ports.

Also if you'd like to add some specific controls to your Pisound audio project, you can easily make your own custom MIDI controller.

Arduino sketch code and more information available here.

 

Audio

Parameter Value
Input/Output Coupling AC and DC respectively
Input/Output Channels 2 / 2 (Left and Right)
Input/Output Type ¼" (6.35mm) Stereo
Input/Output Resolution 24bit
Sampling Frequency (Fs) 48kHz, 96kHz, 192kHz
Input/Output SNR @ 1kHz 110dB *
Input Impedance 100kΩ || 2pF
Input Gain (G) 0dB to +40dB
Input Clip LED Yes
Input Clip Voltage 5V (Peak to Peak) *
Full Scale RMS output @ 1kΩ   0V to 2.1V
Loopback Bandwidth (-3 dB) 7.5Hz - 23kHz *
Loopback THD @ 1kHz < 0.045% *
Loopback Latency 2.092ms **
Phantom Power None


* Conditions - G = 0dB, Fs = 48kHz
** Conditions - Fs = 192kHz, Pi Model = 2, Buffer Size = 128 Frames

 

MIDI

Parameter Value
Input/Output Connectors DIN-5 Female Sockets
MIDI Loopback Latency 2.105ms
Activity LEDs Input & Output

 

Other

Parameter Value
Current Draw < 300mA @ 5.1VDC
Dimensions 56mm x 100mm
Weight 67g

 

Compatible Raspberry Pi Models

Raspberry Pi 1 Model A+, Raspberry Pi 1 Model B+, Raspberry Pi 2, Raspberry Pi 2 version 1.2, Raspberry Pi 3, Raspberry Pi Zero version 1.2, Raspberry Pi Zero version 1.3, Raspberry Pi Zero W. 

 

KARMA POINTS

Help us spread the word!
If you know someone, who is interested in audio projects - share a link! It takes just a second, but it makes a huge difference for us. Thanks in advance! 

Share on Facebook or Twitter

 

LOVE FROM BLOKAS TEAM
$3 USD

You are awesome!
Thanks for helping us make Pisound a reality. You will receive all the campaign updates and we will include your name in our Board of Honours!

 

EARLY-BIRD SPECIAL
ALL GONE!

1 x Early-bird Pisound board!
$22 discount from MSRP & Free Worldwide Shipping!
Raspberry Pi not included.

Estimated delivery - June 2017

 

SINGLE PACK
ALL GONE!

1 x Pisound board!
$17 discount from MSRP & Free Worldwide Shipping!  
Raspberry Pi not included.

Estimated delivery - July 2017

 

DOUBLE PACK
ALL GONE!

2 x Pisound boards!
$38 discount from MSRP & Free Worldwide Shipping!
Raspberry Pi not included.

Estimated delivery - July 2017

 

UNIVERSITY PACK
ALL GONE!

5 x Pisound boards!
Save $125! Free Worldwide Shipping!
Raspberry Pi not included.

Estimated delivery - June 2017

* Shipments to Non-EU countries are subject to duties and taxes as determined by customs in the destination country.

 

Month Process
March   IndieGoGo Campaign
Late April End of the Campaign
May Parts Sourcing
Late May Manufacturing Begins
Early June Quality Control & Packaging
Late June Backer Fulfillment Begins

 

 

 LAVA GUITARS, ESEMDA,
CONSUTLATION STUDIO,
KAMERA, SONIC PI, SOUNDIUM,
PATCHSTORAGE

 

Our Beta-Testers

Dan Powell, Mattia Bonafini, Borys Kowalewski, Jeremy Bernstein, Guillaume Brunet, Tommaso Rosati, Jonas Urbat, Jeff Merkel, Martin Dupras.

 

Risks and Challenges

To get to the current stable stage we went through 6 hardware revisions, found a reliable local manufacturer and had our beta batch manufactured. At this point Pisound is fully developed and ready to go, so there will be no unexpected hardware or software design issues that could cause any delay to start the production and we know that we will be able to deliver the project as planned.

We can identify one risk though that we, as any other hardware developer, could face - sourcing of the necessary parts and custom components. Unavailable parts could cause a small delay in the manufacturing process (up to a few weeks). A large quantity production has an even more likely chance of it. To be safe we have taken this into account for estimating the shipping date.

 

Some Post-Assembly Photos by Our Manufacturer 

* The shipped Pisound may slightly differ from what is shown in the above media.

It single-handedly allows to perform multiple forms of interactions, such as single click, double click, triple click and hold.Its functionality can be customized according to your needs. By default, using The Button you can open patches straight from a USB thumb drive, safely close them, shut down the Raspberry Pi and even launch “pisound” Wi-Fi hotspot, so that you can connect to the device via SSH, VNC or send WiFi-MIDI messages directly to your Pi using a smartphone or tablet.Our favorite use-case for it - you can run your Pure Data patches, without any need to connect a display, keyboard or mouse, just by plugging in a USB drive containing “main.pd” file, any optional MIDI controller / keyboard, click The Button once and Voilà!* Triple-click WiFi hotspot works with Raspberry Pi 3 & Zero W out of the box. Other versions require SoftAP capable USB WiFi adapter to be plugged in. Make Your Own InstrumentPisound in combination with Raspberry Pi provides you an easy and quick way to create your own instrument, e.g. digital synthesizer, effects unit, groovebox or sampler. You can use LV2 plugins, SuperCollider, Pure Data, Sonic Pi or any other Linux compatible audio application to take care of the software side of things and Pisound will do the rest.The fastest way to create your own thing is to use Pure Data. Pure Data is a real-time graphical programming environment for audio and video that lets you generate and process audio signals in many different and magical ways. You can find pre-made patches on PatchStorage, write one of them to a USB drive, plug it into your Raspberry Pi, click the Pisound’s button once and enjoy! And if you want to get your hands dirty you can create your own patches too!Liam Lacey from Ask.Audio shows how it goes. You can find his full review here. Live Coding Jam-SessionSam Aaron used Pisound for his Sonic Pi presentation and jam-session at this years' Raspberry Pi birthday party. Both the Guitar and Synth are connected to the stereo input of Pisound.  Glove Controlled Voice Augmenter Tomme, one of our beta-testers, used Pisound to finish his prototype of a glove controlled voice augmenter. The glove is made using Arduino, 2 buttons, 4 flex sensors, 1 XYZ accelerometer and Bluetooth transmitter. Pure Data is responsible for the sound processing. Audiophile Network PlayerUsing Raspberry Pi + Pisound + Volumio/RuneAudio you can build your own Hi-Fi network player. Just connect it to your home stereo system and control it using any device running a web browser. You can find project instructions here. Recording StudioPisound works great with Audacity - an open source, cross-platform audio software for multi-track recording and editing, so you can start recording your creations with just a few clicks. Your Own Internet Radio StationHave you ever dreamed to have your own radio station? Now you can! You just need to use Pisound, darkice and icecast with your Raspberry Pi. You can find project instructions here. Meet Blokas Team - Justinas (guy in the tree), Giedrius (the one in the sky), Jatas (guy with the glasses), Šarūnas (the one that sings), Aida (the smiling one) and the one on a boat is Pranciškus. We love to make things and we love to talk about them, so if you have any questions, you can ask us in the comment section, on our community forums or even chat with us here!If your question is more technical one, you can have a look at Pisound's documentation page here. Over the past 18 months we went through 6 different hardware revisions until we have arrived at the current design. Some of the design options we’ve explored before was using the Raspberry Pi’s UART (RX/TX) pins directly for MIDI interface implementation, however we found that the MIDI 31250bps baud rate is not considered standard in Linux world, achieving it required tinkering with kernel configurations, depended on the CPU frequency, and methods to achieve serial communication using the MIDI baud rate were changing over time. A long term and reliable solution for this was needed, so we came up with the current solution that uses the Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) and a translator microcontroller for the MIDI interface.In addition, we went through multiple power supply designs. For example in the previous revisions we used to have an external power connector. Thanks to the feedback from our beta testers, we found out that for them to get the right power adapter is going to be tricky and expensive compared to using official and highly available Raspberry Pi USB adapter. We adjusted our design and now Pisound is powered straight from the Raspberry Pi board itself. Currently we’re at the point where Pisound has reached a mature and stable state, successfully went through a beta test program, conforms to Raspberry Pi’s Hardware Attached on Top (HAT) specifications and is ready to reach the wider audience.3D-printable case specially designed for Pisound. You can find all the necessary files here. Pisound is compatible with virtually all Linux distributions and software as it comes with an ALSA audio and MIDI driver integrated in mainline Raspbian Linux kernel (ver. 4.4.27+). The pisound-btn daemon, which runs in the background, monitors and reacts to The Button. It uses next to no CPU time, as it executes instructions only when it receives interrupts raised by the kernel when the voltage level on the GPIO pin controlled by The Button position changes.Thanks to the daemon, The Button triggers shell scripts when performing the following actions: single clicking; double clicking; triple clicking; holding the button down. The default scripts for the actions respectively do: start a Pure Data patch from connected USB drive; safely stop the patch and prepare the USB drive for removal; toggles WiFi Hotspot mode; safely shuts down the device. Figure 1.  Response of the sine signal fed to loop-backed (digital→DAC→ADC→digital) Pisound showing the Signal-to-Noise Ratio (SNR) of 110 dB. Calculated Total Harmonic Distortion (THD) is less than 0.05%.Figure 2. Frequency response of the white noise fed to loop-backed (digital→DAC→ADC→digital) Pisound showing the bandwidth (BW) of the device and how it is estimated.The legendary Burr-Brown Op-Amps, ADC and DAC chips are brought together on this little board to exhibit clean signal amplification and conversion between digital and analog realms. The device exceeds HD-Audio standards thanks to its linear bit depth of 24 bits and maximum sample rate of 192 kHz.Even though audio converters and other chips have a pretty good power supply rejection ratio (PSRR) on their own, to ensure low-noise operation in the vicinity of an electrically noisy Raspberry Pi computer, any power line going to the analog stuff is coupled via low dropout regulators (LDO’s) which filters any digital interference out. This design enables Pisound to be graded as a high-fidelity (Hi-Fi) audio device. For example a Hi-Fi device is expected to have the Total Harmonic Distortion value (THD) less than 1% and the Pisound has it less than 0.05% (fig. 1). That means that you can daisy-chain 20 Pisound boards and the chain would still be considered as a high-fidelity device!We also measured the audio bandwidth of the device and as you can see (fig. 2) it is as flat as a proper table and shows -3dB high-pass and low-pass roll-off at 7.5Hz and 23kHz accordingly.Another nice feature is a clip-LED - it will light up whenever the signal at the ADC input is too high and the gain should be lowered. Please see the specs table below for additional specifications of the device. To satisfy your MIDI communication needs, Pisound has 3 options: DIN-5 Input and Output MIDI ports with activity LEDs, WiFi-MIDI and USB-MIDI via Raspberry Pi’s USB ports. Unlike usual MIDI solutions for Raspberry Pi, serial DIN-5 MIDI on Pisound is implemented using high speed SPI and a dedicated microcontroller for translating SPI data to serial MIDI byte streams and it's readily recognized in audio software as an ALSA MIDI device. The loopback latency of MIDI was measured to be 2.105ms. The two MIDI activity LEDs blink based on the flow of MIDI events.In addition, Pisound lets you take advantage of WiFi-MIDI. When WiFi Hotspot mode is enabled via triple clicking The Button, touchosc2midi daemon gets launched. It translates OSC messages to MIDI events so you can control audio software running on Raspberry Pi from your smartphone or tablet.And of course you can use USB-MIDI devices as usual by connecting them to Raspberry Pi USB ports.Also if you'd like to add some specific controls to your Pisound audio project, you can easily make your own custom MIDI controller.Arduino sketch code and more information available here. Audio

It takes just a second, but it makes a huge difference for us. Thanks in advance! Share on Facebook or Twitter LOVE FROM BLOKAS TEAM$3 USDYou are awesome!Thanks for helping us make Pisound a reality. You will receive all the campaign updates and we will include your name in our Board of Honours! EARLY-BIRD SPECIALALL GONE!1 x Early-bird Pisound board!$22 discount from MSRP & Free Worldwide Shipping!Raspberry Pi not included.Estimated delivery - June 2017 SINGLE PACKALL GONE!1 x Pisound board!$17 discount from MSRP & Free Worldwide Shipping!  Raspberry Pi not included.Estimated delivery - July 2017 DOUBLE PACKALL GONE!2 x Pisound boards!$38 discount from MSRP & Free Worldwide Shipping!Raspberry Pi not included.Estimated delivery - July 2017 UNIVERSITY PACKALL GONE!5 x Pisound boards!Save $125! Free Worldwide Shipping!Raspberry Pi not included.Estimated delivery - June 2017* Shipments to Non-EU countries are subject to duties and taxes as determined by customs in the destination country.

   LAVA GUITARS, ESEMDA,CONSUTLATION STUDIO,KAMERA, SONIC PI, SOUNDIUM,PATCHSTORAGE Our Beta-TestersDan Powell, Mattia Bonafini, Borys Kowalewski, Jeremy Bernstein, Guillaume Brunet, Tommaso Rosati, Jonas Urbat, Jeff Merkel, Martin Dupras. Risks and ChallengesTo get to the current stable stage we went through 6 hardware revisions, found a reliable local manufacturer and had our beta batch manufactured. At this point Pisound is fully developed and ready to go, so there will be no unexpected hardware or software design issues that could cause any delay to start the production and we know that we will be able to deliver the project as planned.We can identify one risk though that we, as any other hardware developer, could face - sourcing of the necessary parts and custom components. Unavailable parts could cause a small delay in the manufacturing process (up to a few weeks). A large quantity production has an even more likely chance of it. To be safe we have taken this into account for estimating the shipping date. Some Post-Assembly Photos by Our Manufacturer * The shipped Pisound may slightly differ from what is shown in the above media.

story:
You hear the world in complex 3D space. But most recorded sound you hear is in simple stereo. You can hear it, but it can’t be recorded which has the depth of space that you get in real life.

Lifelike lets you record the complex, 3D environment of the real world in seconds. Without downloading any app, just use your iPhone, plug in and record, you can make the truly 3D video in seconds.

Listen to the recordings below with headphones to hear the difference.

 

Lifelike 3D Audio Reviews

Binaural Microphones for 3D Sound: Sennheiser Smart Headset vs Scenes Lifelike

Recorded by Derrick Story

Click here for full article

Click here for full article

 

What's 3D audio?

The Lifelike 3D sound recording earphones records the complete soundscape, not only sound, which has precise direction and distance. It captures how the sound moves, where it comes from, and how the surrounding environment changes the sound with reflection, refraction, diffraction and other sound variations. When you use the headphones to play back your recording, you can easily pinpoint the variation of sound.

The truly 3D video/audio records dynamic sound-field information, which contains direction, distance, and movement. The 2D recordings we are accustomed to are “head-in effect,” which means the sound is limited without direction and distance information, giving you a less all encompassing sound experience.

 

With 3D sound recording, you are immersed in a panoramic experience ——you’ll be surrounded by sound just like you’re there. The sound is not just a 3D sound effect, it is true 3D sound. You can feel every precise variation in that sound-field, from a whisper, to a distant wind chime, just like you’re really there. 2D sound is flat, but 3D sound makes you feel you’re truly there in the scene.

 

The Lifelike 3D earphone is the most convenient in-ear 3D audio recording product for iPhone. It’s the world's first portable 3D recording earphone and a binaural recording product, which uses your real head, instead of a dummy head, for immersive recordings.

Lifelike 3D earphone comes with a Digital Box built-in best-in-class high fidelity processor, which is equipped with a MFi-certified lightning connector to integrate seamlessly with all compatible iOS devices. Use the Lightning port to your iPhone, open the video app, and then you will have a REALISTIC, IMMERSIVE 3D video. After sharing, use any headphones to replay, audiences will feel like they are there.

  • Proprietary HRTF optimized algorithm
  • Analog to digital signal conversion
  • Sound-field Mix, Auto Gain, EQ Compensation Included

Binaural recording simulates real sound as a human hears it. Lifelike is adapted to this theory with customized “shark gill” earbuds that are perfectly airtight, helping Lifelike 3D earphone capture even the slightest changes in spatial audio. The Digital Box has a maximum 44.1kHz/16bit decoding ability that outputs integrated immersive audio/video for multiple production usage.

Lifelike comes with an earphone and a digital box. Based on the “Dummy Head Record” and “HRTF” theory, Lifelike made by a mimic human acoustic system which uses two microphones in the left and right ear. The patent “Shark Gill” guarantees airtightness and comfort. The digital box has a built-in best-in-class processor with proprietary decoding algorithms to output 16bit/44.1kHz lossless high-fidelity audio. It comes with -32dB high mic sensitivity and 110dB SNR as well as wide-range frequency. Based on HRTF theory and its proprietary algorithms, it reproduces the natural environment sound-field. Lifelike captures 3D sound true to distance and direction, recording the subtleties of how the sound moves, where it comes from, and how the surrounding environment changes the sound through reflection, refraction, diffraction and all the variations. After recording, DSP in the Digital Box converts the analog signal to digital through Scenes HRTF optimized proprietary algorithm, including sound-field mix, auto gain, and EQ compensation. The final 3D audio will save to your iPhone, and you can share with anyone to make them feel like they’re really there.

Based on HRTF, Lifelike imitates the way human ears hear in the natural world bye recording immersive 3D audio with directions, distances and movement tracks. Instead of dummy head structure, Scenes Lifelike can be directly placed on your real head to record and perfectly reproduce REALISTIC & IMMERSIVE audio. This technique is the first of its kind.

Scenes Lifelike uses the iPhone to charge and is equipped with a built-in power save mode for lower battery consumption. Scenes Lifelike can directly use the iPhone’s built-in video/voice memo to record without downloading any app, and also supports other mainstream apps to record 360° video and audio. Recordings are directly saved in iPhone storage without any other SD card, and once recorded, can be shared instantly.

The Scenes Lifelike earphone is also a HiFi earphone, providing the best aural  experience. It is equipped with an independent mic-integrated, lightning connection. The Shark Gill earbud adopts ergonomic design, hence the “shark” namesake, for in-ears earphone, which fits the ear canal perfectly and steadily. This earbud is airtight and steady, differentiating it from other earbuds on the market. Having considered every individual’s different auricle, each purchaser with four pairs of various sized in-ear silicon “Shark Gill” earbuds for a more customizable listening experience.

Lifelike 3D Audio Reviews

 
 

Based on real head recording, the Lifelike VR recording earphone can capture every acoustic playing sound with every single chord, bring audience the superb immersive 3D music with “Live Presence.”

 
 

Wherever you go, you can use your iPhone matched with Lifelike recording earphone to capture the real sound field in the natural world, and one-touch share your recorded 3D video with family and friends, so they feel like they’re really there.

 
 

Surround 3D audio substitutes the traditional two-channel stereo, bringing listeners a sense of immersion.

 
 

 

You can fully record a live band’s enthusiastic performance and audience reactions with Scenes Lifelike.

 

 

By wearing the earphones on your head or using the dummy ear stand holder, ASMR hosts can record ASMR videos in immersive 3D sound with just an iPhone as if they’re whispering in fans’ ears in real time.

Add on perks

Scenes 3D Stand Holder is not a common stand holder, it uses advanced bionic technology to create a simplest human acoustic skeleton structure, and remain aesthetics consideration. The bionic ears provide perfect recording environment for anchors in livestreaming, podcasting, or producing.

Lifelike 3D audio headset not only works with IOS devices, but also can be worked with any computers, Windows and Mac. Many professional music makers may prefer this way. Just clain this little adapter, you can use Lifelike 3D audio headset with any computers.

  • Humanized UI experience
  • VR audio track system, more editable info for post-production
  • 32 objects operation sync

 

About Us

Scenes focused on cutting-edge virtual reality audio technique research and development, and has the most vivid sound-field reproduction solution in the world. Lifelike is the first consumer-grade product, also the first portable 3D recording earphone in the world. We’re so glad Lifelike won the Innovation Award of 2017 CES Asia, which will be a strong motivator for us to keep going, and we want everyone can take advantage of black technology.

What do we think of the future of entertainment? Today’s consumer is very sensitive to light and sound in the real world and we want people to experience the same immersive feeling in the virtual world that they do in reality. It’s our dream for the future.

story:
If you want more reach as a DJ you need the Spreadcaster. We have built the best DJ live streaming tool in the world and are now giving livetime accounts to the first users. The Spreadcaster is the best way to stream live audio on all platforms at the same time. The Spreadcaster Lifetime Account gives you unlimited access to all current and all upcoming functions of the Spreadcaster. We are constantly developing our tool and working on new features. These livetime accounts are only distributed in this Indigogo campaign. 

Broadcast live: Simultaneous casting to all platforms  

Stream on Facebook live, Twitch, YouTube live, Periscope, Twitter and many other platforms simultaneously. Reach all your fans on all platforms simultaneously and get no effort to use multiple devices. One audio input for all channels. One software for all channels. Add the wanted channels once. Your selection will be saved and you can go on Air with one click. 

 

Better content: Add visualisers to your Livemix

Create viral mixes for all existing video streaming platforms. Choose from our live audio visuals for your livestream and personalize your livestream with your own logo. We are constantly adding new Visualizers. Resident DJs also get an exclusive pack of well performing, exclusive Visualizers. Spreadmix members can enjoy Visualizers of the TOP 100. With the Lifetime Account you have access to all current and upcoming Premium Visualizers. The right Visualizer makes a big difference in the performance, your branding and the engagement of your livestream. 

 

Record: Record your livesets in highest quality (320kbit/s)

The Spreadcaster records your livesets in highest audio quality and thus creates the most authentic form of audio content that you can share on streaming platforms. The highest available audio quality is automatically pre-selected. Offer your fan a real experience and don't make any compromises in sound quality.

 

Easy to use: Intuitive, easy interface

We have built the easiest to use DJ tool. Go live with one click. The soundcard is automatically recognized and selected. All functions are intuitively accessible. We are constantly optimizing the user experience for our DJs. Don't make it unnecessarily complicated and save time. 

Unfortunately we can't write it in the listed functions yet, but we're talking to a lot of labels and lawyers right now and will probably be able to whitelist the sets streamed via Spreadmix. We have also been working for several years on our own platform, on which DJs can stream with the Spreadcaster. You can't be warned on our platform. This will probably not go live until 2020, but then with noise. We bring the app and the website live at the same time. We start festivals, work with the TOP 100 and roll out campaigns. It'll be a place you can't afford not to use.

 

We are happy if you share our campaign, become part of the movement and support us. We are there for every single user and look forward to your feedback

It'll be a place you can't afford not to use.




 


We are happy if you share our campaign, become part of the movement and support us. We are there for every single user and look forward to your feedback

SO WHY DID WE CHOOSE TO TEST FOR RADIATION ? 

WELL WE WANTED YOU TO REST ASSURED THAT YOU WERE PURCHASING A PAIR OF WIRELESS EARBUDS WHICH ARE FCC APPROVED! THAT'S WHY. 

HEY MY FRIEND. YOU MATTER! 

SO HOW DID WE DO IT ?

WELL, WITH ALOT OF  TIME, TEARS, AND TESTING. 

TAKE A LOOK FOR YOURSELF : 

TESTING THE DELAY RANGE N ALL OF THAT.....

AND MORE FUN

 

SO WITH THAT BEING SAID. 

THIS PRODUCT FEATURE'S FCC APPROVAL FOR YOUR RADIATION PROTECTION. 

 

YOU ONLY GET ONE RUN. 

SO WHY NOT MAKE IT YOUR BEST? 

BECAUSE THE TRICK IS : 

 

 

WELL HOW DO THEY SOUND MATE? 

GLAD YA ASKED MATIE. 

SHORT ANSWER: " THEY SOUND GREAT!" , PEOPLE HAVE ALSO SAID THAT AS SOON AS YOU PUT THEM ON , IT'S LIKE YOU ENTER INTO A WHOLE NOTHER WORLD. 

WE THINK THAT IS PARTLY BECAUSE OF THE NANO TRACING TECHNOLOGY FOUND WITHIN THE EARBUDS. SO THAT WHEN YOU PUT THEM ON, THE SOUND ROOM DESIGN ALLOWS YOU TO EXPERIENCE THE FINE TUNE SOUND ROOM QUALITY. THIS WAY WHEN YOU MOVE THROUGH NOISE , YOU'RE NOT JUST HEARING LOUD , BUT YOU'RE HEARING SOUND. 

HERE. 

TRY A PAIR ON. 

SORRY BRO. I DROPPED THEM IN WATER. 

THOUGH YOU DID THAT ON PURPOSE, I CAN FORGIVE YOU. 

YOU KNOW WHY? 

WHY? 

BECAUSE I JUST GOT DONE EATING , AND NOT ANGRY. 

JUST KIDDING. IT'S BECAUSE STOOPID AUDIO , GOT SOME MAJOR WATER PROTECTION.

SO DON'T SWEAT IT..... ( NO PUN INTENDED )

HOW DO THEY MATCH UP TO THE COMPETITION? 

YOU TELL ME : 

 

CAN I TAKE THEM TO THE GYM? 

YES PLEASE DO. 

WE WANT YOU TO HAVE A GREAT WORKOUT. 

OH AND DON'T FORGET, ONCE YOU PAIR THEM TO YOUR DEVICE, YOU'RE THEN SET FOR AUTO PAIRING.  SO JUST PULL THEM OUT THE MAGNETIC CASE, AND YOU'RE GOOD TO GO.
